title: Java Developer
description:
Key Responsibilities
  
  

The role of Java Developer contributes to the development of a modern, cloud-first system using a
  
  

modern technology stack. The role is responsible for a specific problem domain within the
  
  

broader Quinyx system while being expected to take ownership of the system as a whole.
  
  

The role is required to cooperate with other backend or frontend developers, QA engineers,
  
  

product owners, and designers across the R&D team. Java Developers are expected to take an
  
  

active part in the platform and its technologies, as well as communicate the considerations and
  
  

lessons learned to other members of the team.
  
  

What you’ll bring to the team
  
  


  
Develop Quinyx towards an even more secure, more event-driven, and modern platform.
  
  


  
Participate in and lead discussions around technical subjects in the broader R&D team.
  
  


  
Participate in technical interviews during our hiring process to help us spot new talents.
  
  


  
Development skills in Java, with a focus on microservices using the Spring Boot
  
  

framework

title: Senior .NET Developer
description:
*Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That’s why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other emotionally and financially, and lead more enriched lives.*

**Why Rebtel?**


At Rebtel, we build complex, high-performing applications that power global communication. Our backend development is structured yet flexible—an environment where agility, creativity, and technical excellence are not just encouraged but expected. We maintain an agile workflow, prioritize clean, maintainable code through regular refactoring, and champion knowledge-sharing through code reviews. If you're looking for challenging problems that will stretch your skills and ignite your creativity, you’ll feel right at home.

  

**About you**


As a Senior .NET Developer who not only loves solving complex problems but is passionate about code quality, and building scalable and testable solutions.  

  

You’ll be adequately self going, contribute to technical discussions, and aspire to deliver clean, robust code. You have a sharp eye for simplicity amidst complexity and pride yourself on thorough, thoughtful development—including writing tests for critical components. Whether working closely within your team or leading a project area independently, you’re confident, collaborative, and proactive.


**Requirements:**

* Expertise in .NET Core, .NET Framework, and related technologies (e.g., ASP.NET)
* Strong knowledge of both SQL (MSSQL) and document-oriented databases like MongoDB
* Hands-on experience with DevOps practices and deployment tools (Git, Azure DevOps)
* Practical knowledge of containerization using Kubernetes
* Experience integrating with GraphQL and REST APIs
* Excellent communication skills in English
* We don’t evaluate skills by number, however we believe ideally you should have worked at least 7+ years to gain the right seniority
* Passionate about writing clean, structured, and testable code
* Puts really high weight on test coverage of their code
* Elevates the performance and mindset of the team around them
* Naturally curious, loves experimenting with new technologies
* Strategic vision for product and codebase growth

**Our Offer To You**


At Rebtel, you are the most important asset and we strive to provide a comprehensive package of benefits and perks that enhance your well-being and work experience. Here are some of the things you can expect from us:  

  



* Pension Plan
* Health Checkups and Private Medical Insurance
* 10k Bucket (net) for wellness allowance and Travel (benefit taxed)
* Discount on gym memberships
* Bonus program
* Parental pay
* 30 days annual vacation
* Relocation Support, if you're joining us from afar, we'll assist you in making a smooth transition.


Rebtel is an international workplace, and at the office, we speak English; therefore, high English proficiency is required.

*We are Rebtel. We come from all around the world to create products for anyone who has crossed a border. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*
company_description: Our team mirrors our global audience: we are a diverse team of people from over 30 different countries that get together everyday.

title: STEP Developer
description:
**Shape the Future of Master Data at Nobia**


We are looking for an **MDM STEP Developer** who is passionate about building structured, high-quality data solutions that empower better customer experiences and smarter business decisions. At Nobia, Europe's leading kitchen specialist, we’re on an exciting transformation journey—and data is at the heart of it.  

  



This role plays a key part in supporting and developing our Master Data Management (MDM) solutions, focusing on **STEP** as our core MDM platform. You will contribute to harmonized business processes and a global SAP template that supports our "One Company" agenda—enabling smarter operations across Europe.

 **As an MDM STEP Developer, you will:**

* Support the build and roll out of **STEP** as Nobia’s primary MDM system
* Design solutions aligned with our application development road map to ensure security, scalability, and fit-for-purpose systems
* Develop STEP configurations and enhancements based on business requirements using core application components and clean, concise code
* Collaborate with the Lead Architect to shape the future of our product data platform, including PIM and DAM
* Design and maintain **product data interfaces**, data models, data upload processes, and maintenance workflows
* Understand and document data flows from source to consumer systems
* Ensure data cleaning, validation, and integrity to maintain high-quality data
* Work closely with analytics and business stakeholders to identify needs and prioritize development

Be an advocate for strong data foundations within the organization  

* 

  

**We’re looking for someone who:**

* Brings strong technical skills in **Java or JavaScript**, **XML**, and **JSON**
* Understands data integration with downstream systems and is detail-oriented about information design
* Has experience with **data profiling, data mapping**, and **quality rules development** in STEP
* Is fluent in English

**Why Nobia?**


At Nobia, we don’t just build kitchens—we build sustainable solutions that improve lives. You’ll be part of a purpose-driven company where people matter, ideas grow, and potential is realized.


We offer:


* A collaborative and forward-thinking environment
* Opportunities for learning and development


We hire for attitude and train for skills. If you're ready to be part of something meaningful, we’d love to hear from you.


**Apply Now**


Ready to join a company that’s shaping the future of kitchen living through data? Apply today and become part of Nobia’s data-driven journey. **Last day to apply is June 29, 2025.**

title: Androidutvecklare - Linköping!
description:
Vill du bidra till ett tryggare samhälle och älskar att koda? Vår kund söker en androidutvecklare som vill bidra till att utveckla högsäkerhetslösningar för kunder som myndigheter och offentlig sektor. Sök tjänsten redan idag!

**Om företaget**


Vår kund är en ledande aktör inom cybersäkerhet och informationssäkerhet, med över 40 års erfarenhet av att utveckla teknik som verkligen gör skillnad och bidrar till ett tryggare samhälle. Deras kunder är främst myndigheter, säkerhetsorganisationer och offentlig sektor. Här skapas innovativa lösningar som gör det möjligt att arbeta säkert och effektivt på distans – även när känslig information hanteras.

 **Vem är du?**


För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:

* Har minst 1-2 års erfarenhet av Android-utveckling.
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Har en relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning.
* Grundläggande förståelse för matematik och problemlösning.
* Svenskt medborgarskap.
* En säkerhetsprövning kommer att genomföras under anställningsprocessen.

**Vad vår kund erbjuder:**

* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö med högt tekniskt fokus och varierande roller.
* Balans mellan kön, åldrar och bakgrunder – De tror på att mångfald skapar framgång.
* Arbete i ett kompetent team där glädje, utveckling och samarbete är centralt.
* Stora möjligheter att utvecklas i din roll




**Välkommen med din ansökan!**


Tror du att detta skulle passa dig, eller kanske någon du känner? Vi har ett löpande urval och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag, tveka därför inte - utan skicka in din ansökan redan idag!


Rekryteringen kommer hållas av Ed:Za Group. Har du några frågor eller funderingar relaterade till tjänsten och processen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta oss.

title: Mjukvaruutvecklare (C/C++)
description:
Världsledande inom ingenjörstjänster – vi samlar ett globalt team av ingenjörer, forskare och arkitekter för att hjälpa världens mest innovativa företag att frigöra sin fulla potential. Från självkörande bilar till livräddande robotar – våra experter inom digital och mjukvaruteknik tänker utanför ramarna och levererar unika FoU- och ingenjörstjänster inom alla branscher. Bli en del av oss för en karriär full av möjligheter. Där du kan göra skillnad. Där ingen dag är den andra lik.


**Din roll**  

Som mjukvaruutvecklare hos Capgemini Engineering kommer du att arbeta med avancerad teknologi med möjlighet till både lokala och globala projekt. Där kommer du få möjlighet att agera både rådgivare, innovatör och utvecklare mot våra slutkunder. Vårt kontor i Linköping är i en tillväxtfas vilket medför stora utvecklingsmöjligheter. I dagsläget är vi ca 15 medarbetare inom bla produktutveckling, inbyggda system och mjukvarutveckling. Samtidigt är vi en del av det globala Capgemini där samarbeten både inom utanför landsgränserna ger oss fantastiska möjligheter att få arbeta med de senaste teknikerna och industrierna. I Sverige är vi ca 3000 anställda, och globalt har vi över 340.000 kollegor!  



  

*I denna roll kommer du att arbeta med:*

  

* Mjukvaruutveckling med tyngdpunkt på C/C++, Python, RTOS, och Linux.
* Agilt arbete och inolvering i alla utvecklingsstadier och steg i processen när nya produkter och lösningar ska fram och att arbeta tätt tillsammans med andra.
* Varierande uppdrag och projekt, men du kommer alltid att ha en viktig roll i våra snabbrörliga utvecklingsteam som utmanar gamla sanningar och tar både produkter och kunder till nästa nivå.
**Din profil**  

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom utveckling inom C/C++
* Erfarenhet av systemdesign, säkerhetskritisk utveckling, realtidssystem (RTOS), Linux, Yocto, debugging, test och verifiering, Python, Java, Ada, AI mot target / on edge.
* Erfarenhet från några av de vanligaste kommunikationsprotokollen för embedded exempelvis TCP/IP, SPI, I2C, CAN.
* Erfarenhet från system för versionshantering, så som Git, och continuous integration/ continuous delivery (CI/CD).
* Master/Civilingenjör inom relevant område
* Flytande i svenska och engelska i både tal och i skrift
* Du har ett stort generellt teknikintresse och är troligtvis intresserad av det som händer inom AI, kanske kopplat till datorseende, robotik, självkörande teknik och som verktyg för att förstärka dina förmågor och din kreativitet.
**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas hos oss**  

* Spännande uppdrag med cutting-edge teknologi. Både inom Sverige och globala projekt
* Tydlig karriärplan med skräddarsydda utvecklingsmöjligheter genom Capgemini Engineering Academy
* Flexibla arbetsvillkor och konkurrenskraftiga förmåner
* Möjlighet att delta i globala ingenjörsgemenskaper och olika interna nätverk
* Kollektivavtal som säkerställer dina anställningsvillkor
  

#LI-MS8


**Om Capgemini**  

Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
  

Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com
company_description: World leader in engineering and R&D services, Capgemini Engineering combines its broad industry knowledge and cutting-edge technologies in digital and software to support the convergence of the physic

title: RAN System Developer
description:
Lund,Skåne,Sweden
Job ID**766463**
Join our Team **About this Opportunity:**

  

The future inspires us — but inventing it defines us. At Ericsson, we do both! As a global leader in 5G, we’re already engaging with 6G and its exciting challenges. At RAN Baseband System Management, we define the behaviour of advanced radio network features. To support our growing global 5G and 6G deployments, we’re seeking an experienced Radio Network System Developer to join our team in Lund, Sweden.

  

You’ll work with signal processing, radio resource management, physical layer algorithms, multi-antenna systems, cloud deployments, 5G/6G simulations and live network support. We collaborate across Ericsson, customers, partners and 3gpp to drive innovation and global standards. By developing simulators and analyzing real network data, we improve algorithms, lead troubleshooting and shape wireless systems, beamforming, cloud computing, and AI/ML — all as part of a global team building tomorrow’s networks.

 **What you will do:**

* Perform systems studies primarily in Radio Resource Management, e.g. Scheduling, Link Adaptation, time critical communication, and control channel radio resource management
* Specify system features and functions, test cases, algorithms, use cases, parameter settings and address any interactions with legacy features and functionality
* Develop network-level software simulations for the performance analysis of 5G features and algorithms
* Drive continuous improvements of products, simulation tools and processes (feature flow)
* Perform solution package (SP) study lead and participate in system trouble report team
* Contribute to advances in 5G standards in terms of 6G readiness
* Contribute to innovation and Ericsson IPR. file invention disclosures and patents
* Support 5G system verification and perform analysis of test results
* Support the deployment of new 5G products and features into customer networks. Work with Customer troubleshooting and analysis. Understand customer configurations and issues
* Work collaboratively on new features, simulations and improvements with cross-functional development and customer engagement teams worldwide
 **Skills you bring:**

  

We believe that you have MSc or PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Physics or the equivalent level of knowledge. A background in communications theory and digital signal processing is valuable.

* Work experience in relevant areas such as 5G NR and possibly 6G
* Software development skills to strengthen product understanding and give an ability to use and develop simulators. Languages include Java, C and C++. Knowledge of simulation environments and tools like MATLAB would be an asset
* Good knowledge of 5G NR mobile communication systems, especially in the areas of the Physical Layer and Radio Resource Management
* Product development knowledge preferably with an understanding of Lean and Agile methods
* An analytical approach with an interest in creativity and innovation
* Dedication, self-driven and a strong interest in cooperating with others
* An interest to learn and grow your skills continuously being a part of our team
* Excellent communication skills in verbal and written English building positive relationships internally as well as externally
**What happens once you apply?**

title: Senior Java Developer
description:
**About MAG (in brief!)**


At MAG Interactive we make mobile games that feel good. As a part of this fun and dynamic industry, it’s our mission to spread joy to players around the world. With over 350 million downloads globally, we credit our success to our awesome colleagues and we hope you'll join the team!

**The role: Senior Java Developer**


Join our small but mighty server team and help power the backend for all of MAG’s mobile games which are played by millions around the world. Based in our Stockholm office, you’ll work alongside three experienced developers to build and maintain the services that keep our games running smoothly.


This is a unique opportunity for someone who enjoys solving complex challenges at scale. Our team may be small, but we’re responsible for a large, sophisticated system that supports the entire MAG game portfolio. From core multiplayer features to tools that help us operate and scale our games, you’ll get to work on projects that really matter.


We’re currently using Java 21 and deploy everything ourselves using Google Cloud in a DevOps setup. You’ll find plenty of variety here and the chance to take real ownership of your work.

**What you’ll do:**

* Design and develop backend features and services
* Support game teams in Stockholm and Brighton
* Work on both quick-win projects and longer-term systems
* Take part in peer reviews and testing to ensure high-quality code
* Maintain and refactor legacy systems
* Deploy and monitor services in production (DevOps style)

**Your skills/experience:**

* Approx 5+ years of Java development experience
* Solid knowledge of cloud platforms (we use GCP)
* Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
* A proactive, DevOps mindset. You help drive ideas from conception to release and share ownership of the feature in production
* Focus on writing clean, testable, maintainable code
* Excellent communication skills and team spirit
* Fluent in EnglishDegree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent experience

**Nice to have (but not a dealbreaker):**

* Interest in mobile gaming
* Familiarity with Unity or C#
* Experience in the games industry

**Our Tech Stack:**


We run a monolithic game server on Google App Engine, with real-time features on Compute Engine using Netty and FlatBuffers.

**Languages:** Java 21 (plus some C# & Python)

**Frameworks & Tools:** Micronaut, gRPC, Jersey REST, Swagger, Lombok, Jetty, Reactive

**Protocols:** HTTP, FlatBuffers, Protobuf

**GCP Services:** App Engine, Compute Engine, Cloud Run, Cloud Functions, Datastore, Cloud SQL, Memorystore (Redis/Memcache), Pub/Sub, Dataflow, BigQuery, Kubernetes

**Testing & CI/CD:** Gatling, GitHub, GitHub Actions, SonarCloud, Terraform


**Perks and Benefits:**

* Generous company bonus
* Company mobile phone and contract
* Favorable pension and private health insurance package
* Flexible work hours
* Seasonal kick-offs
* Gym allowance
* Generous learning and development budget
* Monthly After works
* Enhanced parental leaveCompany wide carbon off-setting and CSR initiatives
* Free Swedish lessons (if you wish to learn a new language!)

  

**At MAG, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated and empowered to bring their true selves to work!**  

  

**Our recruitment processes are designed to prevent bias and discrimination against people regardless of; gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, or any other aspect.**  

  

**About MAG**  

  

We are MAG Interactive – a leading mobile developer and publisher of casual mobile games built on a wealth of creativity and passion. We thrive on creating quality experiences that make our players want to come back for more. And Players agree! Combined, the Company’s games have been downloaded more than 350 million times. We create a good times factory with a global reach that continues to grow.  

  

We are all part of a creative, positive and trusting environment where everyone has a sense of ownership over their activities and pride in their work. This open and collaborative working culture at MAG is key to our ability to continuously create top notch games.  

  

Every game released from MAG Interactive has reached a multi-million player base and reached the #1 position in its category in a large number of countries. Our games have been selected Best of Google Play, Best Of App Store by Apple and have reached the #1 word game spot in over 100 countries.  

  

MAG Interactive was founded in Stockholm in 2010.
company_description: MAG Interactive is a mobile gaming company built on a wealth of creativity and passion. We create quality experiences that make our players want to come back for more!

title: Baseband SW Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About the Opportunity**

  

Ericsson is world leading in 5G and we have started the 6G journey. L1 development in the baseband unit is a vital block. We are looking for Senior L1 developer to join us.

  

When joining Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead, and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology. This is a place where you're welcomed as your own perfectly unique self and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team.  

  

**What You Will Do**

  

Your focus will be in Uplink Physical layer (L1) parts of the Baseband SW. L1 is vital building blocks in our market leading 5G Radio Access Network (RAN) solution and in future within 6G. You will be placed in a section with two ULL1 teams which will give you a opportunity to,

  

a) Work with the people with good product knowledge..  

b) Grow quickly.  

c) Make a large impact.

  

You will work as a senior developer. Your contribution will be in the feature development and product architecture evolution.


You will be writing inventive, high quality, clean, optimized and mostly threaded code in a multi-core environment. You will be writing unit tests and Multi component tests to secure the quality of your deliveries. And you will have lots of fun.

  

In a nutshell, you will,  

* Develop 5G baseband architecture, functionality, and features.
* Contribute in 6G development.
* Write inventive, high quality, clean, optimized and threaded code in a multi-core environment.
* Maintain and improve the quality of L1 part of the Baseband product.
* Perform trouble shooting and customer support.
* Work with continuous improvements of products and processes.
 **The Skills You Bring**

  

Technical Competences:  

* C programming skills and experience is a must.
* Signal processing knowledge.
* Assembler experience is desired.
* Experience in Python, C++, Erlang, Matlab is a plus.
* Multi-core processor programming.
* Real time embedded systems knowledge.


  

Other Competences:  

* Quality focus & Problem-solving
* System thinking
* Knowledge sharing, collaboration, and communication
* Flexibility and willingness to multitask.
  

Your personal qualities are important for us and we believe that you are productive, creative and interact easily with other people. In addition, you have the ability to plan and drive your own work in order to reach common goals together with your team. You are also able to adapt and respond quickly to change. Furthermore, you are positively set and strive to meet and exceed our customers’ expectations.  

  

Your Qualifications & Experience:  

* 4+ years of software development experience
* BSc level (MSc preferred) in a technical discipline or the equivalent level of knowledge.
* English Skills
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

**Req ID:** 767917

title: Master Developer AI in PHY
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity**

  

Are you ready to create the future of AI powered 5G/6G network?

  

Baseband Technology under Ericsson AI and other emergency technology department leads technology foresight and development in the core system area of real-time processing (baseband), both for AI and non-AI methods and workloads. This includes AI models in the Physical Layer of RAN, accelerated compute technology, the SW toolchain for AI on Ericsson Silicon (EMCA) and other areas vital to the AI mission, such as overseeing field data collection and AI model validation over-the-air, simulators, cloud infrastructure and more. The responsibility area also includes leading technology incubation for future SW-defined baseband planforms, for example using GPU’s and various accelerator devices.

  

We know Ericsson Physical Layer (L1) has been in leading position drive high performance of our 5G network; In the era of AI technology trend, we are looking for someone really have big passion to join us to leading innovation in wireless communication by integrating artificial intelligence or other cutting-edge technology into baseband physical layer processing.

  

We are looking for a Master Physical Layer software developer whoever have big passion/belief to master AI and other emerging technology as well to join our global team. No matter where you join, all are very welcomed, since we are a global baseband team, we have baseband experts cross different Ericsson sites: Stockholm, Lund, Linkoping and Ottawa.  

  

**What you will do**

  

In this role you will actively contribute or lead the technology scotting on new algorithm, in particular focus on Neural Network and other deep learning algorithm to enhance implementation of NR/6G Physical Layer functions running on the Ericsson purpose build RAN compute as well as COTS (Commercial off the shelf) General compute platform, i.e x86/ARM with various accelerator.

 **What you will bring**

  

* 8+ years of experience in baseband digital processing, primary physical layer.
* Strong competence in C/C++, Python is a must.
* Quick learner with open mind is a must.
* MSc degree in Electrical engineering or Computer Science or equivalent.
* Consistent track record to deliver complex software solutions, on-time and with quality.
* Work/lead an international, agile and multi-site teams both collaboratively and autonomously.
* An enthusiastic demeanor, eager to continue growing and learning, and helping your team to learn.
* Innovating, adapting, and responding to change.
* Care about diversity and inclusion, encourage speak-up environments, come with a strong can-do attitude.
* Any relevant experience on Embedded AI for RAN.
* Experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX) and cloud platforms, especially AWS (SageMaker, Lambda, Step Functions, S3, etc.).
* Experience with deep learning AI models (Large language Model/LLM, Convolutional Neural Networks/CNNs, Transformers, etc.).
* Excellent written and verbal communication, interpersonal, time management, and multitasking skills.

 **Additional Qualifications:**

  

* Experience developing through the Development Pipeline and software content management principles and tools – CI/CD (DevOps), git, Gerrit, GitHub, Jenkins, Spinnaker.
* Experience work with different AI compiler framework (LLVM,MLIR etc).
* Experience with Nvidia tool chain, CUDA, Kernel design.
**Application**

  

We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 60% work-from-the office. Last day to apply is 20th June 2025. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail. If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact **Yevgeny Meshulin**, Sr. Talent Partner at yevgeny.meshulin@ericsson.com.  

Locations: Kista, Lund or Linköping (Sweden) or Ottawa, Canada.

* Quick learner with open mind is a must.
* MSc degree in Electrical engineering or Computer Science or equivalent.
* Consistent track record to deliver complex software solutions, on-time and with quality.
* Work/lead an international, agile and multi-site teams both collaboratively and autonomously.
* An enthusiastic demeanor, eager to continue growing and learning, and helping your team to learn.
* Innovating, adapting, and responding to change.
* Care about diversity and inclusion, encourage speak-up environments, come with a strong can-do attitude.
* Any relevant experience on Embedded AI for RAN.
* Experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX) and cloud platforms, especially AWS (SageMaker, Lambda, Step Functions, S3, etc.).
* Experience with deep learning AI models (Large language Model/LLM, Convolutional Neural Networks/CNNs, Transformers, etc.).
* Excellent written and verbal communication, interpersonal, time management, and multitasking skills.

 **Additional Qualifications:**

  

* Experience developing through the Development Pipeline and software content management principles and tools – CI/CD (DevOps), git, Gerrit, GitHub, Jenkins, Spinnaker.
* Experience work with different AI compiler framework (LLVM,MLIR etc).
* Experience with Nvidia tool chain, CUDA, Kernel design.
**Application**

  

We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 60% work-from-the office. Last day to apply is 20th June 2025. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail. If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact **Yevgeny Meshulin**, Sr. Talent Partner at yevgeny.meshulin@ericsson.com.

title: Master Developer AI in PHY
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity**

  

Are you ready to create the future of AI powered 5G/6G network?

  

Baseband Technology under Ericsson AI and other emergency technology department leads technology foresight and development in the core system area of real-time processing (baseband), both for AI and non-AI methods and workloads. This includes AI models in the Physical Layer of RAN, accelerated compute technology, the SW toolchain for AI on Ericsson Silicon (EMCA) and other areas vital to the AI mission, such as overseeing field data collection and AI model validation over-the-air, simulators, cloud infrastructure and more. The responsibility area also includes leading technology incubation for future SW-defined baseband planforms, for example using GPU’s and various accelerator devices.

  

We know Ericsson Physical Layer (L1) has been in leading position drive high performance of our 5G network; In the era of AI technology trend, we are looking for someone really have big passion to join us to leading innovation in wireless communication by integrating artificial intelligence or other cutting-edge technology into baseband physical layer processing.

  

We are looking for a Master Physical Layer software developer whoever have big passion/belief to master AI and other emerging technology as well to join our global team. No matter where you join, all are very welcomed, since we are a global baseband team, we have baseband experts cross different Ericsson sites: Stockholm, Lund, Linkoping and Ottawa.  

  

**What you will do**

  

In this role you will actively contribute or lead the technology scotting on new algorithm, in particular focus on Neural Network and other deep learning algorithm to enhance implementation of NR/6G Physical Layer functions running on the Ericsson purpose build RAN compute as well as COTS (Commercial off the shelf) General compute platform, i.e x86/ARM with various accelerator.

 **What you will bring**

  

* 8+ years of experience in baseband digital processing, primary physical layer.
* Strong competence in C/C++, Python is a must.
* Quick learner with open mind is a must.
* MSc degree in Electrical engineering or Computer Science or equivalent.
* Consistent track record to deliver complex software solutions, on-time and with quality.
* Work/lead an international, agile and multi-site teams both collaboratively and autonomously.
* An enthusiastic demeanor, eager to continue growing and learning, and helping your team to learn.
* Innovating, adapting, and responding to change.
* Care about diversity and inclusion, encourage speak-up environments, come with a strong can-do attitude.
* Any relevant experience on Embedded AI for RAN.
* Experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX) and cloud platforms, especially AWS (SageMaker, Lambda, Step Functions, S3, etc.).
* Experience with deep learning AI models (Large language Model/LLM, Convolutional Neural Networks/CNNs, Transformers, etc.).
* Excellent written and verbal communication, interpersonal, time management, and multitasking skills.

 **Additional Qualifications:**

  

* Experience developing through the Development Pipeline and software content management principles and tools – CI/CD (DevOps), git, Gerrit, GitHub, Jenkins, Spinnaker.
* Experience work with different AI compiler framework (LLVM,MLIR etc).
* Experience with Nvidia tool chain, CUDA, Kernel design.
**Application**

  

We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 60% work-from-the office. Last day to apply is 20th June 2025. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail. If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact **Yevgeny Meshulin**, Sr. Talent Partner at yevgeny.meshulin@ericsson.com.  

Locations: Kista, Lund or Linköping (Sweden) or Ottawa, Canada.

title: AI Fullstack Developer - 100% Remote (from anywhere in Europe) (m/f/d)
description:
**Are you a highly skilled full stack developer with a minimum of 3 years of experience? Do you have exceptional problem solving and communication skills? If you value the flexibility of remote work and uninterrupted focus time, apply now at Digistore24 – one of Germany's top IT companies...**  

  

**Who is Digistore24?**


We are one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe.

**What drives us?** **We shape the digital future!** Our mission is to empower people with our software and expertise to share their knowledge online, enabling them to fulfill their dream of an own business. As a result, millions of people gain access to information that helps them reach their goals. To keep pace with our growth, we aim to expand our teams sustainably. We emphasize working with experts and strong personalities who share our values – regardless of their location.

 **Your new dream job**

* **Backend AI Integration into PHP-based Systems:** Develop, expand, and maintain PHP middleware that connects our AI solutions with Zendesk and Digistore’s backend systems
* **Frontend Feature Development with AI Capabilities:** Build and enhance modern frontend components—optionally powered by AI tools—to enable interactive, intuitive user experiences for both internal and external applications
* **Tool-Based Workflow Automation (e.g., n8n):** Design, implement, and maintain process automations using workflow tools like n8n. This includes triggering actions via APIs, managing webhooks, and ensuring seamless orchestration across internal and third-party systems
* **Set Up and Maintain Databases:** Configure, monitor, and maintain relational databases that support the integration middleware, ensuring efficient data access, transformation, and storage for AI-powered features and backend services
* **Sustain and Extend Integration Codebase:** Take full ownership of the PHP-based middleware layer that acts as the connective tissue between AI services and Digistore’s platform—ensuring long-term stability, scalability, and performance

**Your benefits at Digistore24**


You will play a crucial role in shaping our cutting-edge projects in our collaborative work environment – while enjoying flexibility in working time and location.

* Work in our partner's **coworking spaces** (max. 3 days a week) or in your **home office**, as long as you can guarantee uninterrupted internet access
* Regular **further education**
* The **stability** of an extremely successful German high-tech company that is **funded by its successful product** and not by investors
* Outcome focused teams and a culture of direct feedback
* **Modern equipment**
* International, **collaborative team** with strong cohesion
* **Spectacular team events** in various European countries
* **Autonomy** from day one
* Contribution to the **retirement scheme**
* Work in your **team on a first-name basis**, without a dress code, and at eye level
* **Flexible working hours** from Mondays to Fridays

 **Your superpowers**

* **Expertise in PHP and full-stack web development:** Proven experience in building and maintaining scalable applications with PHP backends, databases and modern frontend tech.
* **AI affinity and OpenAI ecosystem familiarity:** Comfortably uses AI APIs like OpenAI, with practical understanding of prompt engineering and AI capabilities.
* **API and niddleware integration proficiency:** Skilled in connecting services via APIs and integrating third-party platforms with internal systems.
* **Tool familiarity (n8n, Zapier, etc.):** Ability to build complex automation flows with tools like n8n, with a deep understanding of event triggers and webhooks.
* **Flexibility and willingness to take on challenges:** Openness to handle tasks outside core expertise when needed, showing motivation and contributing to team goals in unfamiliar areas.
* **PHP (Symfony or custom frameworks):** Advanced-level backend engineering skills, ideally with experience in maintaining larger codebases and crafting robust middleware logic.
* **JavaScript, HTML, CSS (Frontend Basics + React/Vue):** Good working knowledge of frontend stacks to assist or own end-to-end feature development.
* **REST API & Webhook Integration:** Comfort with designing and integrating APIs, handling authentication flows (OAuth2, API keys), and managing error resilience.
* **Database and Data Layer Management (SQL, NoSQL, Elasticsearch, etc.):** Proficient in managing and interacting with various types of data systems, including relational databases (e.g., SQL), NoSQL stores (e.g., MongoDB), and search-optimized data layers (e.g., Elasticsearch). Skilled in data modeling, querying, transformation, and extraction using appropriate tools (e.g., SQLAlchemy, Pandas), supporting scalable integrations and AI-enhanced features.
* **n8n,** Make.com **or Similar Workflow Tools:** Building and maintaining workflow automations connecting Digistore systems with 3rd party apps.

**This position is NOT for you if**

* ... you lack strong PHP development experience: This role centers on working within a PHP-based middleware—robust backend PHP experience is critical.
* ... you want to train or deploy AI models: This is not an ML Ops or model-training role—focus is on AI integration, not research or deployment pipelines.
* ... you are not comfortable with automation platforms like n8n: Daily work involves process orchestration—understanding these tools is essential.
* ... you are not confident developing full-stack features alone: The role involves both backend and occasional frontend contributions—autonomy is expected.
* ... you struggle to translate AI potential into product features: While deep AI knowledge isn’t required, you must be fluent enough to identify valuable applications and integrate them.

**Our values**  

https://careers.digistore24.com/en/culture-and-core-values


Please take a REALLY close look at the values. Are you ready to live them?

title: C# Developer
company_industry: Gambling Facilities and Casinos and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**C# Developer** 




  





***\*Please note that this is 5 days a week in the office in Stockholm\****




  





 Our client is a slot game studio looking to expand their team with an experienced C# developer to help build and maintain the high-performance backend system that powers their remote gaming infrastructure.
 



  





 You will join a team of seasoned developers and work to shape the future of their platform.

* Develop and deliver scalable, high-performance features for our C# / ASP.NET platform.

**Required Skills & Experience** 




  




* Proven experience in backend development using C#.
* Good understanding of ASP.NET; hands-on experience is preferred, but trainable for the right candidate.

* Hands-on experience implementing caching mechanisms such as in-memory caching and Redis.

* Skilled in using C# debugging tools to diagnose and resolve complex issues.

**On offer** 




  




* Competitive salary
* Office based central in Stockholm
* Collaboration with top-tier developers
* Salary 55K - 70K SEK per month

title: Full-Stack Java Developers - Product Development IT
description:
We now recruit multiple positions for two different teams!
   

  

 Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.
   

  

 Do you want to be a part of our journey? Great – please continue reading!
   

  

 What we do
   

  

 In Product Development IT, we develop digital tools that support the entire R&D process. Our solutions help accelerate innovation in areas like electrification, autonomous vehicles, and sustainable materials.
   

  

 We work in agile teams with end-to-end responsibility, delivering scalable, cloud-native solutions used globally.
   

  

**About The Teams**
 We’re hiring for two different teams – both working closely with R&D engineers and stakeholders.
   

  

 In a collaborative and transparent culture, you’ll work with other developers, business analysts, and product owners.
   

  

 We value knowledge-sharing, continuous learning, and curiosity.
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 You will be working as a full-stack Java developer using agile and DevOps engineering practices and be part of the full development cycle – from idea and architecture to coding, testing, deployment, and monitoring.
   

  

 Responsibilities include:
   

  

  

* Design and develop cloud-native applications in AWS.
* Work with both the frontend and backend
* Develop APIs and data flows for smart integration.
* Help improve development practices, CI/CD pipelines, and system architecture.
* We believe in taking ownership, working iteratively, and staying close to the user.


 Who you are
   

  

 We’re looking for experienced full-stack developers who:
   

  

  

* Are confident in Java and frontend frameworks like Angular.
* Have experience working in cloud environments (AWS preferred).
* Know their way around APIs, SQL/NoSQL databases, and CI/CD pipelines.
* Are curious, pragmatic, and love solving real-world problems through tech.
* It is a bonus if you also have a passion for frontend and UI/UX design


 We’re recruiting for several positions, so whether your strengths lie in backend, frontend, or somewhere along the full-stack spectrum, there’s room to tailor the role to your profile.
   

  

 As a person, you are a true team player and enjoy collaborating in an agile way of working. You are open-minded, transparent with your work, and happy to share knowledge and ideas with your colleagues. Furthermore, you are passionate about writing code and have the ability to explain complex topics in simple terms in fluent English.
   

  

 Why join us?
   

  

  

* Work in a friendly, open, and highly skilled team.
* Help shape the digital backbone of future transport.
* Freedom to explore new technologies and approaches.
* A hybrid workplace – a mix of remote and onsite in Södertälje.
* Career opportunities within a global tech organization.
* Benefits like result bonuses, pension plan, subsidized lunch, and the Scania Job Express bus from Stockholm.


 Ready to code the future?
   

  

 Then, please send in your application including a CV, answers to the application screening questions, and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-06-09. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and coding tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact Mikael Pihlblad, recruiting manager, at mikael.pihlblad@scania.com or Philip Axelsson Moberg, recruiting manager, at philip.axelsson.moberg@scania.com.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Software Developer 3
description:
**Job Description**
 The Java Platform Group is responsible for developing features and enhancements for the Java programming language. The Serviceability team within this group is responsible for developing features which make it easier to triage, troubleshoot, monitor and optimize Java applications. These features encompass a wide range of technologies including the JVM Tools Interface (JVMTI), Java Debugger Interface (JDI), Java Management Extensions (JMX), Serviceability Agent, Attach Framework, and a host of tools supporting JVM profiling, monitoring and management. We work closely with the Compiler, Runtime, and GC teams to collaborate on new feature design and development.
   

  

 Career Level - IC3
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**RESPONSIBILITIES**
 As a member of the Java Serviceability team, you will be responsible for the design and development of new Serviceability features and for ensuring quality across multiple Java release trains, working in collaboration with other internal Oracle teams and the OpenJDK community to provide support for emerging Java technologies. You will provide maintenance of current Serviceability features and design new features that help keep Java vibrant.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Functional knowledge of the Java language and of the JVM, including garbage collection mechanics, classloaders, byte-code instrumentation, and idiomatic Java programming
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering or the equivalent
* Strong hands-on design and development experience in Java development
* Experience in native development
* Experience in multi-platform development
* Experience in C/C++ coding
* Ability to create proof of concepts, code prototypes to showcase improvements.


**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s challenges. We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 We know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. That’s why we’re committed to growing an inclusive workforce that promotes opportunities for all.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer competitive benefits based on parity and consistency and support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by emailing accommodation-request\_mb@oracle.com or by calling +1 888 404 2494 in the United States.
   

  

 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

title: Software Engineer Typescript (Frontend Mid/Senior), Remote
description:
Everything we do is powered by our customers! Featured on Deloitte's Technology Fast 500 list and G2's leaderboard, Maropost offers a connected experience that our customers anticipate, transforming marketing, merchandising, and operations with commerce tools designed to scale with fast-growing businesses. With a relentless focus on our customers’ success, we are motivated by curiosity, creativity, and collaboration to power 5,000+ global brands.
   

  

 Driven by a customer-first mentality, we empower businesses to achieve their goals and grow alongside us. If you're ready to make a significant impact and be part of our transformative journey, Maropost is the place for you.
   

  

 Become a part of Maropost today and help shape the future of commerce!
   

  

**About The Position**
 We are looking for an open minded and enthusiastic mid-level engineer to join our team. If you are interested in developing and maintaining a mature product that millions of people use daily, we would love to meet you! We are a product-driven team, and we’re looking for someone who loves to be engaged in the product development process and appreciates being able to deliver an outcome without depending on other engineers.
   

  

 The role will be based in Europe. Core working hours for this role are 9:00am-5:00pm CET (+/- 2 hours).
   

  

**What You’ll Be Responsible For**
* As a software engineer, focusing primarily on the frontend on our team, you'll be working with other engineers to further develop and architect our search and merchandising as a service product.
* On the frontend we have our main backoffice dashboard written in vue.js and we develop and maintain integrations for our customer's ecommerce stores as a react based SDK and, more recently, also packaged natively for specific platforms such as Shopify.
* The TypeScript backend is responsible for several microservices, from managing the product configuration to integration with various platforms. The main database is PostgreSQL, and we also use cool tech such as Apache Pulsar.
* We’re an empowered product team, firmly committed to collaborative problem solving. We write specs and share the decision-making. We work in two-week sprints to deliver greatness.
* Designing and writing maintainable, readable and elegant code and rearchitecting and refactoring existing software where needed
* Contributing to technical and product specs, and collaborating on architecture and design decisions together with the other stakeholders
* Embracing feedback on your specs and your code as an opportunity for continuous improvement and collaborative design, and carrying out spec and code review for your coworkers
* Testing the software you build for reliability and robustness using different testing paradigms and libraries


**What You'll Bring To Maropost**
* Have at least 3 years of experience with frontend frameworks/libraries (VueJS)
* Have experience with vanilla TypeScript, HTML, and CSS. Ability to manipulate the DOM, understand event-driven programming, and build responsive web applications is a strong plus.
* Have some experience with backend javascript frameworks (we use Node/Express and Node/Nest with TypeScript)
* Appreciate well-designed APIs and can contribute to their design (REST or GraphQL, we use both)
* Understands modern cloud native infrastructure (we use AWS/GCP)
* Appreciate good developer experience and make ours even better by introducing new tools and iterating on processes
* Are generous with your communication, whether it is about new ideas, praise, or very kindly phrased constructive feedback
* Like to learn new things, have an open mind and want to share your knowledge with your coworkers
* Are an effective technical and non-technical communicator (our company language is English)


 What’s in it for you?
   

  

 You will have the autonomy to take ownership of your role and contribute to the growth and success of our brand. If you are driven to make an immediate impact, achieve results, thrive in a high performing team and want to grow in a dynamic and rewarding environment – You belong to Maropost!

title: Backend Developer
description:
Join our team to build next-gen systems that process
 **real-time data** 
 from
 **edge-connected devices** 
 , delivering unique, high-impact insights to our users.
   

  

 You'll work with
 **cutting-edge cloud technologies** 
 , scalable architecture, and modern backend stack to power integrations across a rapidly evolving IoT landscape. If you're passionate about building high-performance, cloud-native systems that turn data into action — we’d love to talk.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Exploring new technologies
* Collaborating on and writing specifications for innovative ideas
* Developing new features using Python
* Staying up-to-date with the latest tech trends
* Building APIs for our energy-saving app


**What You'll Need To Succeed**
* 5+ years of experience in backend development with Python
* Solid skills in REST APIs, Django, PostgreSQL, and Git
* Experience building containerized microservices and working with cloud platforms (preferably AWS)
* Strong communicator, able to explain technical concepts to non-experts
* Collaborative mindset and drive to create value for end-users
* Fluent in English


**Bonus If You Have Experience With**
* Kubernetes
* IAC tools like Terraform
* Knowledge of time-series data
* Experience with IoT-related technologies


**What You’ll Get To Work On**
* Tech That Drives Change: Tackle meaningful backend challenges that help accelerate the green energy transition.
* Impact That Matters: Every feature you build helps people lower their energy use and cut emissions.
* Scalable Systems at the Edge: Work with real-time data from smart meters and connected hardware to build scalable, cloud-native solutions.
* A Team That Loves to Build: Join a group of curious, committed developers solving real problems at the intersection of software and sustainability.


**What Greenely Offers Beyond Tech**
* Meaningful Mission & Real Impact: Join a purpose-driven company where your work helps build a more sustainable future and empowers people to take control of their energy use.
* Great Benefits: Enjoy a 5,000 SEK annual wellness allowance, paid wellness hour during work hours, private health insurance, occupational pension, competitive salary, and more.
* Flexibility & Growth We value in-person collaboration at our centrally located Stockholm office, but offer flexibility to support your work-life balance. You'll also get plenty of opportunities to learn, grow, and influence how we work and what we build.
* Innovative & Collaborative Culture: Work with a curious, motivated team in a fast-moving industry where new ideas are welcomed, and no two days are the same.


**Start Date:** 
 Flexible – ideally sometime after summer.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (Vasagatan 40)
   

  

**About Greenely**
 Greenely aims to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer through technology. Greenely's integrated mobile application enables households to optimize their energy consumption, reduce their electricity costs, and participate in grid balancing services. By connecting various energy assets in the home, Greenely's platform allows consumers to manage their energy usage efficiently while contributing to the stability of the power system. Greenely's solution addresses the challenges of the modern energy landscape and promotes a more efficient, sustainable, and reliable power system. By providing consumers with savings and new revenue streams, Greenely drives the transition to a cleaner and more resilient energy system.
   

  

 WE ARE
 **bold and push the limit.**
 WE BELIEVE THAT
 **f** 
****ast is better than slow.****
 WE
 **t** 
******hink like owners.******
 WE
 ****lead with knowledge.****
 Greenely is on a mission to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer by using technology. We are a digital energy provider that helps people reduce their electricity costs by optimizing the home and car's electricity usage with smart technology in an app.
   

  

 Greenely, with the support of Nordic venture capital companies, has a mission to make it possible for households all over the world to connect, control and optimize their energy usage. We ultimately believe that the best electricity is the one that is not used at all, both for the wallet and the planet!

title: Senior Java developer
description:
**Är du en erfaren Javautvecklare som söker nya utmaningar?**
 Hos B3 Innovation får du möjligheten att arbeta i en miljö där innovation och samarbete står i fokus. Vi söker dig med djup kunskap inom Java och som trivs i en dynamisk och inkluderande arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Om rollen som Javautvecklare på B3 Innovation**
 Som utvecklare hos oss kommer du att:
   

  

* Utveckla högkvalitativa och skalbara lösningar.
* Samarbeta med ett tvärfunktionellt team av experter.
* Delta i design och arkitektur av nya system.


**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har god erfarenhet och arbetat som utvecklare under en längre tid. Du som har hunnit både göra misstag och även lära av dem. Förhoppningsvis tycker du om att arbeta i team, dela med dig av dina kunskaper och vill fortsätta att lära dig nytt.
   

  

 Våra krav för att du ska passa i denna roll:
   

  

* Du behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.
* Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet av Javautveckling.
* Du har god kunskap att jobba med Java, Kotlin, Spring, Microservices (gärna i CI/CD-miljö)
* Du har god kunskap att jobba med olika ramverk som React, Angular och Vue.
* Du har ett öga för detaljer och brinner för att leverera kvalitativa lösningar.
* Du är bekväm med moderna utvecklingsmetoder som Agile och DevOps.
* Har du dessutom kunskaper inom Techlead blir vi extra glada!


 Varför B3 Innovation?
   

  

* Innovativ Kultur: Vi uppmuntrar kreativitet och nya idéer.
* Inkluderande miljö: Vi värdesätter mångfald och strävar efter en arbetsplats där alla känner sig välkomna.
* Balans och flexibilitet: Flexibilitet är centralt, vilket gör att du kan forma din arbetsdag för att få livspusslet att gå ihop. Vi förstår vikten av balans mellan arbete och fritid och erbjuder därför flexibla arbetstider.
* Gemenskap: Hos oss blir du en del av ett stöttande team som arbetar tillsammans för att nå gemensamma mål. Det handlar inte bara om “jobb jobb jobb” hos oss. Vi anordnar allt från tech-workshops till sociala aktiviteter som stickcaféer, spelkvällar och AW.


**Om B3 Innovation**
 Vi är kända för vårt fokus på innovation och förmåga att leverera värde till våra kunder. Genom att kombinera djup teknisk expertis med en stark förståelse för våra kunders verksamhet, skapar vi lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Vår kultur bygger på öppenhet, samarbete och en passion för teknik.
   

  

 Vi prioriterar personlig utveckling och erbjuder verktyg som B3 Academy, TechTalks och "Lunch & Learn" för att du ska kunna växa.
   

  

 Upptäck möjligheterna med B3 Innovation. Som utvecklare får du arbeta inom spännande branscher som media, bank och finans, energi, offentlig sektor, telekom och e-handel. Oavsett om du optimerar TV-sändningar, utvecklar digitala banktjänster eller skapar smarta hem, hjälper vi dig att hitta det perfekta uppdraget som matchar dina intressen.
   

  

 Våra toppbetyg i medarbetarundersökningar visar att nöjda kollegor är kärnan i vår framgång. Är du redo att kliva in i en miljö där utveckling och trivsel går hand i hand?
   

  

 Som sagt, välkommen till B3 Innovation – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Är du redo att ta nästa steg?**
 Skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av vårt engagerade och innovativa team!
   

  

 Om du är mer nyfiken på oss så kan du läsa mer om oss här: https://www.b3.se/innovation
   

  

 Om du har funderingar så hör gärna av dig till Kenneth Andersson på +46706678050 alternativt mail kenneth.andersson@b3.se
