title: HR Manager GCO and Employee Experience
description:
**Ready for a tasty job? We are now looking for a**
**HR Manager GCO and Employee Experience to join our team in Stockholm**
 Do you want to contribute to Fazer's continued development and growth? As a HR Manager for our Global Commercial Organization (GCO) and employee experience, you’ll act as an advisor to business leaders, providing HR support across all aspects of the employee lifecycle. You’ll run initiatives that foster a positive, engaging, and high-performing workplace, while championing employee satisfaction, development, and well-being.
   

  

 This role covers a broad HR scope including workforce planning, employee relations, talent acquisition, performance management, and change support. You’ll also lead local engagement strategies, support onboarding and offboarding, and drive talent and leadership development. A key part of your role is ensuring compliance, promoting a culture of inclusivity, and continuously enhancing the employee experience.
   

  

**What will you bring to the team?**
* 3-5 years of experience, in an HRBP or HR Generalist role.
* Understanding of HR functions, labor laws, and HR best practices.
* Excellent communication, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data interpretation.
* Project management skills with a keen eye for detail and organization.
* Creative problem-solving abilities and a proactive mindset.
* Familiarity with HR systems and digital tools that enhance employee engagement.


 To thrive in this role, we see that you enjoy working in an environment with an open atmosphere. You will be part of a tight team that works across boundaries and is ready to help wherever needed. You are a curious and collaborative team player with a pragmatic approach who readily adapts to changes.
   

  

**Why choose Fazer?**
 It all starts with the people. You’ll join a global HR team of professional, supportive, and development-minded colleagues who inspire one another to grow and succeed. We offer you a key role in advancing Fazer’s people priorities and making a real impact on the business. We’re passionate about what we do — and about finding the right person to grow with us.
   

  

 We at Fazer want to provide a culture of diversity and inclusiveness where all employees can experience an equal working community with a motivating, respectful and safe work environment. In the team, there will be the right balance of challenges and rewarding projects to provide a platform also for individual development.
   

  

**Ready for a tasty job? Apply now.**
 We look forward to receiving your application by June 15th. We process applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait too long to submit yours.
   

  

*Fazer, The Food Experience Company, enables people to enjoy the best moments of their day. Our mission, Food with a purpose, builds on our strong more than 130-year heritage, consumer first approach and innovations to create the sustainable food solutions of the future. With our dedicated team of approximately 5,000 professionals, we focus on fast-moving consumer goods and our direct-to-consumer business in Northern Europe, and beyond with exports to more than 40 countries. Fazer’s operations comply with its Code of Conduct that is based on the Group’s values and the UN Global Compact. In 2024, Fazer Group had net sales of 1,200 million euros.*
***Northern Magic.***
***Made Real.***

title: Partner & Growth Manager
description:
🚀
 **About Divly** 

  





 At
 **Divly** 
 , we’re a fast-growing startup simplifying crypto taxes. Our mission is to empower crypto users in Europe with intuitive, accurate, and easy-to-use tax tools. We build tailored solutions that make it easy for users to stay compliant, no matter where they are.
 



  





 We’re growing fast and looking for a
 **Partner & Growth Manager** 
 to help us accelerate through strategic partnerships as well as influencer & affiliate marketing.
   




 🌟
 **The Role** 

  






 As our
 
**Partner & Growth Manager** 

 , you'll be instrumental in driving Divly's user acquisition, brand visibility, and revenue through strategic partnerships, and influencer & affiliate marketing
   






  




**🔑 What You’ll Focus On** 

  





**Strategic Partnerships (Core Focus)** 





 This is the heart of the role. Your primary responsibility will be to identify, develop, and scale partnerships that drive user acquisition and product integrations.
 



* Identify, reach out, and nurture high-value strategic partnerships (crypto wallets & exchanges, fintech platforms, and more).
* Build and manage a structured partner pipeline from outreach to signed agreements
* Plan and execute co-marketing campaigns with partners
* Act as the bridge between our dev team and partners, making sure integrations align with partner needs and that expectations are clearly understood and prioritized on both sides.
* Develop compelling partner assets: pitch decks, one-pagers, collaborative marketing material, partner landing pages, and social posts etc.



  





**Affiliate & Influencer Marketing:** 



* Recruit and manage crypto influencers and affiliates
* Track performance, handle payouts, and deepen key relationships
* Build scalable onboarding and FAQ content



  





**Improve Divly’s Reach:** 



* Get Divly Listed strategically on crypto directories, industry-specific websites, and platforms.
* Spot new partnership-driven revenue opportunities.



  





 📌
 
**Who You Are:** 

  




* You have 0-5 years of experience in partnerships, influencer marketing, affiliate marketing, or growth marketing.
* You're a proactive relationship-builder who thrives on outreach and strategic collaboration.
* You communicate clearly, persuasively, and professionally, both in writing and verbally.
* You enjoy working autonomously, owning projects end-to-end, and making tangible impacts.
* You're excited about crypto, fintech, or SaaS and eager to learn fast in a high-growth environment.
* **Bonus:** 
 You speak a second language such as French, German, Italian or Spanish.



 💼
 
**Why Divly?** 

  




* Join an ambitious startup that's quickly gaining traction in the growing crypto tax space.
* Work closely with an experienced founding team and own strategic growth projects from day one.
* Competitive compensation and room for rapid personal and professional growth.
* Optional Friday fun: Some of us occasionally wind down with online games on Friday afternoons — you're always welcome to join



 📍
 
**Location:** 

  




* Stockholm, Sweden (Flexible remote hybrid) / Fully remote also possible if based outside of Stockholm



  






 Ready to grow with us? Let's talk!

title: Augmented Reality Co-Founder / COO (100 % remote) (m/f/d)
description:
We are looking to hire ambitious entrepreneurs to start and scale their own startups.
 


  


 We are serial entrepreneurs, for example Paul Müller (founder Adjust, €1.2B exit) and Petter Made (founder SumUp, €8B) who are eager to support outlier personalities and serial entrepreneurs to build €1B+ companies.
 


  


 We offer:
 


  

  
* A salary while you build your startup as you will directly be employed by us. Alternatively, you can opt for up to
 **€500k** 
 in funding.
  
* **Community** 
 : Access to the top 0.1% of founders, peers and investors
  
* **Personal Development** 
 : Weekly coaching with unicorn-founders
  
* **Funding** 
 : Support in securing a multi-million euro funding round within 12 months (on average, EWOR Fellows raise > €2M after our Grand Pitch)
  
* **Talent** 
 : Hiring support through our network (over 50,000 professionals)
  
* **Distribution** 
 : Support in reaching product-market-fit and building up a sales force / marketing machine
  


  


 Highlighting just one of many success stories, one of our fellows set a record for Europe’s largest pre-seed round by a first-time founder, securing a €12M pre-seed investment.
 


  

 Tasks
   

  
* You will build, and run your own startup in fields such as Augmented Reality
  
* You will embark on an extensive personal development journey crafted by unicorn founders and follow a fully customised programme enhancing your goal, time, and energy management
  
* You will receive support in hiring through our network to over 50,000 professionals and advice as well as best practices from serial entrepreneurs
  
* You will receive coaching in making your startup “investible”, i.e. ready to raise millions in funding
  
* You will iterate your product with us until having reached product-market-fit and receive support in building up a sales force or creating a marketing empire respectively
  


  

 Requirements
   

  
* Based in Europe or the Americas or open to relocate
  
* Willingness to take full responsibility for your own startup and scale it to €100M+ in revenues
  
* Excellent communication skills and English language
  


  


 Join us and build a €1B+ company with us!

title: Influencer Marketing Manager
description:
Do you enjoy working with content creators and finding ways to connect games with new audiences?
   

  

 Do you follow what’s happening in gaming communities and see the value in long-term partnerships built on trust and shared interests?
   

  

 As the first Influencer Marketing Manager at Snowprint, you'll work with Warhammer 40,000: Tacticus, a live mobile strategy game with a large and growing community. You’ll take ownership of our content creator partnerships from the ground up.
   

  

 You’ll take responsibility for our creator collaborations, from identifying new voices to running and evaluating campaigns. You’ll work closely with influencers to create content that is in line with the IP guidelines and our goals.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 You’ll build and manage relationships with content creators across YouTube, Twitch, TikTok, and other platforms. You’ll plan and run campaigns, provide clear creative guidance, making sure everything is in line with strict IP guidelines.
   

  

 You’ll manage a six figure budget, track data, analyze said data and make sure the campaigns are meeting our profitability goals. Whether you're working on an upcoming launch or building ongoing partnerships, your role is to help our games be discovered by more audiences around the world.
   

  

 You’ll support creators from first contact to final campaign, making sure everything runs smoothly and stays on-brand. You’ll track performance, learn from results, and look for ways to improve how we work.
   

  

 What you bring
   

  

 You have a few years experience working with influencer marketing. You enjoy games and understand the communities around them. That helps you make thoughtful decisions about which creators to work with and what kind of content feels right.
   

  

 You understand how different platforms such as YouTube and TikTok work from a creator perspective, what creators need and how to build great partnerships that are beneficial to everyone involved.
   

  

 You’re organised, confident in negotiations, and comfortable managing budgets and reporting on results. You work well with others and communicate clearly, whether you’re coordinating a campaign or providing feedback on content. You bring a structured approach to your work but are open to testing and learning along the way.
   

  

 Where you’ll work
   

  

 Our Stockholm studio is in Södermalm and our Berlin studio is in Mitte, with a hybrid working model. We work from the office Tuesdays and Fridays, to allow for closer collaboration and socializing, other days it's up to everyone where they feel most comfortable to work. We support hybrid work by supplying you with the right setup and tools.
   

  

 We are open to you being based in either Stockholm or Berlin, but the majority of our marketing team are based in Berlin.
   

  

**About Snowprint Studios**
 Snowprint Studios believes great games are created by teams of talented, kind and creative individuals in a friendly, supportive and inspiring environment - while maintaining a sustainable life-work balance. For more information on Snowprint Studios go to snowprintstudios.com and follow us on Facebook.
   

  

 At Snowprint Studios, we embrace diversity both in the worlds we create and in our workplace. Join us in shaping the future of gaming!
   

  

* Pocket Gamer Awards 2022 winner ‘mobile game of the year’ and ‘best strategy game’
* Pocket Gamer Awards 2024 winner 'best game we are still playing’ and finalist 'best developer'


**Good to know**
 We are an international company with approximately xx nationalities working here. Our company language is English and therefore your application should be in English.

title: Infrastrukturtekniker
description:
Vill du vara med och stärka Sveriges försvarsförmåga genom avancerad teknik och innovation? Vår kund söker nu ett helt IT-infrastrukturteam som vill vara nyckelspelare i arbetet med att utveckla och förvalta tekniska tjänster som är kritiska för företagets verksamhet. Din roll kommer att vara avgörande för att säkerställa tillgängligheten, säkerheten och stabiliteten i deras system och digitala tjänster.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Teamet som du kommer att ingå i kommer att hantera en viktig IT-infrastrukturplattform för ett av våra kunds affärsområden, vilket är avgörande för förvaltning och utveckling av tekniska tjänster. Ett betydande fokus kommer att ligga på att säkerställa tillgängligheten till systemet, vilket kräver höga standarder för säkerhet, stabilitet och noggrannhet.
   

  

 Som person förväntas du vara organiserad och van vid att ta ansvar. Du är en person som agerar och är noggrann i dina åtaganden samt strävar efter att göra ett utmärkt arbete tillsammans med ditt team. Ditt team kommer att spela en central roll i att leverera och stödja IT-tjänsterna. Det är av yttersta vikt att genomföra och dokumentera arbetet enligt etablerade rutiner och processer.
   

  

**Just Nu Letar Vi Efter**
* Infrastrukturtekniker inom Windows med minst 9 års erfarenhet
* Infrastrukturtekniker inom Windows med 4-8 års erfarenhet
* Infrastrukturtekniker inom Windows med 1-3 års erfarenhet
* Infrastrukturtekniker inom Linux med 4-8 års erfarenhet


 Tillsammans kommer ni att ansvara för och upprätthålla en IT-infrastruktur med vanliga uppgifter. Det inkluderar att leverera klient- och serverbaserade tjänster och att vara en del av drift- och supportteamet. Ni kommer också att hantera patchning och uppgradering av klient- och servermiljön, samt utveckla skript och använda automatiseringsverktyg för att effektivisera arbetsflöden. Dessutom kommer ni att delta i utvecklingen av tjänster kopplade till infrastrukturplattformen och se till att säkerhetskraven efterlevs. Aktivt deltagande i förbättringsarbeten av tekniska lösningar kommer också att vara en del av ert arbete.
   

  

**Din Profil Och KvalifikationerKrav, Teambaserat**
* Erfarenhet av att hantera Windows-servermiljöer och VDI-plattformar
* Några års erfarenhet av Linux med fokus på serverdrift
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med Redhat och CentOS
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att sätta upp nya utvecklingsmiljöer med ovanstående tekniker
* Ett genuint intresse för teknik och att hålla sig uppdaterad med de senaste utvecklingarna inom branschen


**Meriterande**
* Scriptningsspråk som Bash, Python eller Perl
* Kunskap inom IT- och informationssäkerhet
* Nätverksskiktet såsom TCP/IP, switching, routing och brandvägg i datacentermiljö
* Övervakningsverktyg som Nagios/op5
* Teknologier som Docker/Podman, Kubernetes, Git, Jenkins, Artifactory, PostgreSQL, Grafana, VMware
* Konfigurationshantering med verktyg som Ansible eller Puppet
* Horizon
* SCCM
* Microsofts standardprodukter såsom Active Directory, DNS, och WDS


 Uppdraget omfattas av försvarssekretess vilket sätter kvar på arbete på plats fem dagar i veckan. Säkerhetsprövningssamtal och bakgrundskontroll kommer att genomföras. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 370 anställda och med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Business Analyst, Performance Analytics
description:
Are you an analyst with passion for data, analytics an eye for visualization and communication? Do you believe that with the right data you can change people and companies? Join us on our journey to promote situational awareness by empowering our sales and service teams with actionable and decisive insights.
   

  

**About The Position**
 We are strengthening our analysis team with a Business Analyst within Performance Analytics, to develop and enable data driven and customer centric strategic decisions through end-user friendly reports. To do this you will work closely with stakeholders to develop powerful KPI:s and steering components utilizing modern databases and analytics.
   

  

 As Performance Analyst in Consumer Solutions you will always have your end-users in mind, making data and insights truly useful by combining analytics, communication and visualization skills. You are not afraid to apply novel techniques or methods where it needs and your curiosity drives you constantly forward.
   

  

 With a high degree of autonomy, you are confident in your capabilities in stakeholder management and collaboration to identify new areas for support and improvement across a Nordic organisation. Ideal candidates have a few years of relevant experience, excel in a landscape between data engineers and business and with an analytical mindset and experience of working with Microsoft PowerBi and SQL.
   

  

 The role will be part of a Nordic team of three people, and reports to Performance Analytics Manager. The sub-team is part or the Performance Analytics and Insights team of nine people. The position can be based at one of our Nordic Campuses in Norway, Sweden or Finland.
   

  

**Responsibility areas**
 As Business Analyst, Performance Analytics you will collaborate with any part of the Nordic Customers organization, including sales & service, payment & invoicing among many others to understands their business needs. You will To constantly improve our quality and availability of data, you will be the link between Nordic Customers Teams and the internal data team, supporting the development and maintenance of data pipelines with input on logic, harmonization, definitions and new data needs.
   

  

 You are tasked with both shorter and longer project in addition to ad-hoc tasks. You will strive for automating tasks when its possible. You will work both with developing KPI:s and data models on request but as well proactively. Your great autonomy and flexibility in creating the solution enables you to use tools you best believes supports the need, even if it’s more advanced such as machine learning.
   

  

 As the bridge between data engineers and business you will keep the end-users informed and educated of new models, KPI:s and reports. In addition, work closely with the rest of the analysts to ensure we are building best overall solution and share our best practices across areas. You will be responsible together with other analysts of the PowerBI app, maintaining access rights, automation and documentation.
   

  

**We offer you**
* A positive, international working environment where we aim high, built on expertise, ambition, and the urge to succeed.
* A hybrid work model and a holistic view on wellbeing, reflecting our commitment to supporting you, with care.
* A culture built on collaboration and shared success, because we win together.
* The opportunity to shape how we work with lead management as a strategic enabler for customer success.


**Qualifications**
* Higher relevant education, preferably in technology / economics / statistics, with emphasis on quantitative subjects.
* Proven experience in PowerBI including:
* Advanced knowledge of DAX and M -languages, and their pros and cons.
* Ability to work as a Power BI Service workspace admin and a champion who drives insight-driven culture forward.
* Experience with programming languages like SQL, Python, R and visualization tools like PowerBI is an advantage.
* Experience in working with a data warehouse or data lake utilizing Azure and Databricks or similar.
* Familiarity with machine learning concepts is a plus, but not required.
* Good written and verbal ability in English and any of the Nordic languages. Fortum’s working language is English.
* Work experience in relevant field, with proven track-record of creating business growth or improved collaboration through visualization of data.


 Personal qualifications: To succeed in this position, you need strong analytical skills and a data-driven approach to structured problem-solving. A commercial mindset, high drive, and target orientation are key, as well as being an effective communicator and relationship-builder. Being self-motivated and able to prioritize tasks effectively is crucial, along with attention to detail in your work. You are also curious and innovative with a focus on applying new technologies, automation of tasks and using hypothesis testing in your problem-solving approach.
   

  

**About Fortum Consumer Solutions**
 In Fortum Consumer Solutions, our Nordic Customers Business function delivers value to our customers through Smart, Modern, Advisory, Reliable, and Transparent service and sales tailored to their needs. Our scale and international approach enable ongoing investments in employee development, tools, and processes to uphold top-quality, reliable, and efficient standards. This ensures our customers receive world-class solutions and experiences, contributing to profitable and sustainable operations.
   

  

 In Consumer Solutions we are offering our 2.4 million customers reliable and sustainable energy, making their everyday lives easier with new technology and innovative solutions and services.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application by 19.06 at the latest. We screen candidates on an ongoing basis and we might call for interviews before the application deadline. If you would like to hear more about the position, please contact Benjamin Hendler through e-mail benjamin.hendler@fortum.com.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Offering; Value Through People
description:
Går du igång på komplexa, tvärfunktionella transformationer i medelstora till stora företag? Att omsätta kunders förväntningar till verkliga affärsmål, och skapa affärsvärde samtidigt som du rustar kunden till att ta ägarskap för transformationen? Du har stort fokus på din kompetensutveckling och vill bygga erfarenhet inom olika branscher. Om du dessutom vill jobba på ett chefslöst företag där du själv sitter i förarsätet och din ambition styr din utveckling kanske du är en av de stjärnor vi ständigt letar efter!
   

  

**Vad vi gör**
 Inom affärsnoden Value Through People finns vi till för organisationer som vill öka värdet genom människor och höja förmågan att lyckas med affärskritiska transformationer. Med marknadsledande kompetens och mångårig erfarenhet inom Förändringsledning och HR Transformation skapar vi konkret affärsvärde tillsammans med våra kunder. Vi utmärker oss genom vårt nära samarbete, ett genuint ansvarstagande och en helhetssyn som säkrar framgångsrika transformationer. Vi har stort fokus på långsiktiga effekter och resultat.
   

  

**Vi växer och söker fler kollegor som vill jobba inom Value Through People**
 För dig som drivs av att realisera affärsnytta i transformationer samlar Value Through People erfarenheter, kompetens och utmanande uppdrag inom Effektdriven förändringsledning och HR Transformationer. Vi arbetar branschövergripande med alla typer av förändringsprojekt och skapar tillsammans Business Wellness! Vi söker nu dig med förmåga och kompetens inom något av områdena:
   

  

* Change Transformation – erfarenhet av strategisk, taktisk och operativ förändringsledning i samband med t.ex. systemimplementationer, företagsintegrationer och organisatoriska transformationer.
* HR Transformation – erfarenhet av att införa moderna digitala HR-lösningar, t.ex. i samband med förstudier, systemval & upphandling och processdesign & -utveckling med medarbetarens upplevelse i fokus.


**Din profil**
**HR Transformation**
* 2-6 års erfarenhet av HR Tech - antingen som konsult eller i linjeroll – med fokus på projekt/verksamhetsutveckling
* Intresse av att utforska och implementera digitala lösningar för att förbättra HR processer
* Erfarenhet av Employee experience och av arbete med att förbättra medarbetarupplevelsen
* God förståelse för komponenter i olika typer av HR projekt, t.ex. organisationsstruktur, data management, processer etc.
* Universitetsexamen inom relevant område


**Change Transformation**
* 2-10 års arbetslivserfarenhet efter avslutade akademiska studier och en professionell managementkonsultskolning i grunden
* Har jobbat som projekt- och förändringsledare, gärna i kundnära IT- och verksamhetsprojekt.
* Är orädd, kreativ och med en inneboende stark problemlösningsförmåga
* Duktig inom ledarskap, kommunikation och strategi
* Arbetar obehindrat med både svenska och engelska som arbetsspråk i kunduppdrag
* Du vill vara med och bygga affär och utveckla vårt fantastiska team


**Framgångsrika konsulter på Centigo har oftast tre framträdande styrkor:**
**Entreprenörsanda** 
 – De motiveras av komplexa utmaningar och drivs av en stark vilja att lösa dem. Med ett högt engagemang och ansvarstagande, värdesätter de möjligheten att dra nytta av och bidra till det nätverk som Centigo erbjuder.
   

  

**Ambitionsdriven** 
 – De drivs av sina egna höga ambitioner och tar ansvar för sin affär såväl som sin professionella och personliga utveckling.
   

  

**Professionell** 
 – Att arbeta med en hög grad av professionalism är nyckeln till ett framgångsrikt konsultarbete. Våra konsulter är alltid måna om att leverera produkter av god kvalitet till våra kunder.

title: IT Architect - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Stockholm office, we are looking for IT Architects who will collaborate with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on local and international client projects! We develop superior IT strategies, concepts, and solutions actively and on site, applying our technical know-how, experience in IT projects, and analytical and conceptual skills.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
* have a degree in computer science, (business) informatics, engineering, or a related field
* have approx. two years of relevant experience in IT consulting or software development (part or full time)
* know that modern tools such as machine learning, cyber resilience, DevOps, agile methods, AI, and robotics aren't just buzzwords, but essential to sustainable IT architectures
* have broad technical expertise and interest in technology trends
* feel particularly comfortable in interdisciplinary teams and global contexts and are flexible and willing to travel
* are excellent at understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
* Shape the digital transformation of globally leading companies, ensuring their success by evaluating their capabilities and performing feasibility studies
* Manage small, agile development teams in strategic IT implementation programs, establish modern practices like DevOps and CI/CD, and be in charge of the technical implementation of crucial digital requirements such as cyber resilience
* Analyze, develop, and optimize cutting-edge, customized IT architectures while applying your comprehensive understanding of legacy IT, enterprise solutions, and current market developments and trends such as cloud computing and microservices


 Additional info
   

  

**How You Can Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Junior Legal Counsel
description:
**ZIMPLER PHILOSOPHY**
 We are rapidly expanding in new key markets with a mission to simplify payment transactions everywhere. As we grow, we’re on the hunt for the best, most creative people to join us in sharing our guiding principles and goals. People are at the centre of everything we do and our whole purpose and promise stem from making life easier – for our customers and their customers – with the help of our unstoppable Zimpler crew.
   

  

 Every person and identity within the expanding walls of our company matters. It is a well-demonstrated fact that a product’s market share and usability increases as the diversity of the team creating it increases. So, for that reason, and many others, we take great pride in our culture. As we’re on a mission to build a global payment solution, naturally our fantastic employees need to represent the world, too. Are you next to join us?
   

  

 As the fintech industry continues to transform the financial landscape, Zimpler is leading the charge by delivering innovative solutions that empower businesses and individuals alike. We are seeking a passionate and skilled Junior Legal Counsel to join our legal team.
   

  

 Based in Stockholm, you will work with a wide range of legal questions with emphasis on commercial agreements, payment services and data privacy.
   

  

 You will report to our Head of Legal & Compliance and you will work closely with her and our Senior Legal Counsel. The legal team supports the whole business and handles all types of legal questions that arise in the business. Zimpler is a payment institution licensed by the Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority (Finansinspektionen).
   

  

**This Is What You Will Do**
* Monitor the legislative landscape relevant to Zimpler’s business and analyze upcoming legislation as well as support the business in the implementation of such legislation, e.g., new product development or establishing internal rules.
* Provide day-to-day legal guidance and support to all functions within the business on various areas of law, but with emphasis on payment services and data protection including writing legal assessments, participating in different internal forums representing legal and providing your colleagues with guidance and support.
* Negotiate various types of customer and supplier agreements including outsourcing arrangements and ICT third party provider arrangements.
* Handle a wide range of data privacy matters.
* Handle corporate governance matters.
* Support in litigation processes and submissions to competent authorities.


**These are qualities and interests we believe a great candidate for the job will have:**
* You thrive in a fast-paced work environment where each day looks different.
* You enjoy working independently but you also value a strong team culture.
* You believe in combining legal excellence and risk awareness with a strong commercial mindset and thinking one step ahead.
* You’re service minded and great at building trust and strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
* You have an interest in fintech, payment services and you have relevant prior job experience approximately 1-2 years from e.g., a financial institution or a law firm.
* You’re fluent in English and Swedish (our working language is English).
* You have a Masters of Laws degree, preferably from a Swedish University.
* You have a curious mindset with a passion for learning and growth.

title: Senior Salesforce Consultant
job_function: Business Development, Information Technology, and Consulting
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Software Development
description:
**Senior Salesforce Consultant – Leading Nordic Salesforce Consultancy** 




  





 📍 Location: Stockholm / Gothenburg / Malmö (Hybrid)
 



 🗣 Language: Fluent Swedish Required
 



 💰 Salary: Competitive + Excellent Benefits
 



  





  





 We are working with a leading Salesforce consultancy across the Nordics, renowned for delivering transformative Salesforce solutions across both the public and private sectors. Due to ongoing growth, they are now looking for a Senior Salesforce Consultant to join their high-performing team.
 



  





 What You’ll Be Doing:
 


* Leading and delivering end-to-end Salesforce projects across Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, and Experience Cloud and others
* Engaging directly with clients to gather requirements, design scalable solutions, and implement best-in-class Salesforce configurations
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams across sectors, helping organisations maximise their Salesforce investments
* Supporting junior consultants and contributing to solution architecture discussions



  





 What they're Looking For:
 


* 3+ years of hands-on Salesforce experience
* Proven experience working with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, and Experience Cloud and others
* Salesforce certifications (e.g. Admin, Platform App Builder, Sales Cloud Consultant, Service Cloud Consultant)
* Strong understanding of Salesforce best practices and client-facing consulting experience
* Fluent Swedish language skills (spoken & written) – essential
* A proactive mindset with strong communication and problem-solving skills



  





 What’s On Offer:
 


* Clear career progression and a supportive environment that values growth
* High salary and performance-based bonuses
* Full support for Salesforce certifications and ongoing professional training
* Opportunity to work on impactful projects across both public and private sector clients
* Flexible hybrid working and a strong Nordic work-life culture



  





***Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.***

title: Business Controller BA EA
description:
Deliver results. Drive change. Develop your real potential.
   

  

**Electrolux Group**
 Electrolux Group is a leading global appliance company that has shaped living for the better for more than 100 years. We reinvent taste, care and wellbeing experiences for millions of people, always striving to be at the forefront of sustainability in society through our solutions and operations. Under our group of leading appliance brands, including Electrolux, AEG and Frigidaire, we sell household products in around 120 markets every year. In 2023 Electrolux Group had sales of SEK 134 billion and employed 45,000 people around the world.
   

  

**About the role:**
 We are seeking an ambitious and experienced Business Controller that will be responsible for Cashflow, NOWC, and Capex Controlling for the BA Europe, Middle East and Africa. The controller will play a pivotal role in supporting the business in a constantly evolving business environment. This highly visible position requires flexibility in adapting to requirements, as well as a keen attention to detail and a collaborative approach. The role will have direct exposure to senior leadership and business decision-makers and must possess the ability to work independently to find solutions to complex problems.
   

  

 Be part of the team helping the organization to make informed decisions by transforming data and information into business insights while driving collaboration and efficiency across the finance organization in Europe.
   

  

 You will report to Head of Financial Controlling BA EA and in matrix to Head of BA Controlling BA EA, this role is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Review and lead the monthly and quarterly analysis, forecast and reporting for cash flow, investments and net assets
* Review and lead the Annual Plan and Strategic Plan, forecast and reporting for cash flow, investments and net assets
* Analyze cash flow trends and identify potential issues
* Collaborate with finance teams to ensure accurate financial reporting
* Partner with Product Lines and Operations for investment / capex requests, planning and reporting
* Participate balance sheet reviews with legal entities
* Participate in the approval & review process as well as reporting of significant investments
* Review & approve outstanding payment orders.


 As a controller, you will own the monthly and quarterly analysis and reporting process. Drive the financial planning for the total business area and lead continuous improvement efforts across our processes.
   

  

**Qualifications & Requirements:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting (CPA/ACCA an advantage).
* Solid relevant experience, ideally in accounting, financial controlling and analysis
* Strong strategic mindset with a proven track record in budgeting, forecasting, and analysis
* High level of integrity, analytical ability, and business acumen
* Advanced excel skills, experience with SAP and AARO an advantage
* Excellent communication skills in English
* Strong analytical skills
* Highly proactive and self-motivated
* Team player with great social skills
* Tech savvy and strong ability and interest to use financial systems
* Excellence in MS-Office suite, specifically Excel (VBA is a strong plus)
* Excellence presentation skills with ability to translate complex and technical concepts into business insight


**Where you will be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden).
   

  

 We are proud of our culture of inclusivity and diversity. At our Global Headquarters we have 60+ nationalities working together for our common goals. You will be part of this dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefits highlights:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family-friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


 As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.
   

  

 Find out more: https://www.electroluxgroup.com/en

title: Category Manager
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience—fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Do you want to be the superhero of Sweden's grocery retail revolution? Do you have a black (or pink) belt in category management and grocery sales? If you're nodding your head in excitement, keep reading! We're on the hunt for a category mastermind to join our team and help us unleash the awesomeness of Sweden's trendiest digital food chain. At foodora market, we're not just breaking records, we're breaking the mold for the entire grocery industry and now it’s your time to join the ride!**
* Acting as the “business owner” and be fully responsible for the P&L performance of the assigned category
* End to end category management including managing performance of the product portfolio, developing and growing supplier relationships, expanding product selection and supplier base, leading negotiations, setting category strategy, driving sales and margin improvements and creating best-in-class customer experiences
* Ensure foodora market categories has the optimal selection and strategically competitive prices in the market through local and international sourcing
* Source and build strong supplier base to negotiate terms improvement, secure supplier advertising spend, and ensure a reliable and operationally effective flow of goods
* Work to develop new sourcing and extended range to ensure we have high quality, good value goods available to our customers year-round
* Employ data-driven decision making to drive the category. Provide insight to the commercial team and work closely with marketing and supply chain to forecast demand and ensure consistent supply
* Partner with supply chain team to manage inventory levels and wastage
* Work cross functionally with Product, Supply Chain, Operations and Marketing to deliver strategic projects


 Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
   

  

**Our recruitment process will include the following:**
 📞 Telephone interview - Let’s cover the basics!
   

  

 💡 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.
   

  

 🤝 First interview - Time to know each other a bit better!
   

  

 💼 Case interview - Do your magic and show us your skills!
   

  

 ✔️ Reference- & background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues.
   

  

**Start date:** 
 Upon agreement
   

  

**Qualifications**
* 3-5 years experience in merchandising / buying, retail and category management
* Experience in supplier negotiations, pricing and promotion, inventory management and product development
* Superb business judgment with a track record of successful negotiations and overall relationship management (both internal and external)
* Ability to work autonomously in a highly demanding and often ambiguous environment, with strong attention to detail and exceptional organizational skills
* Strong analytical skills
* Great communication skills (both oral and written) are a must
* Mastery of MS Office (particularly Excel, Access, and PowerPoint) is preferred
* Experience in managing Fruits, Vegetables or Meat & Seafood categories will be a plus


 Studies have shown that women and some minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you are interested in this role and you have most of the skills we’re looking for, we encourage you to apply anyway!
   

  

**Additional Information**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora such as free group training at Sats & reduced price on massage.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome Friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and inspiring courses within our learning tool Sana
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: Area Director
description:
Area Director - Stockholm
   

  

**Job Purpose**
 The Area Director has responsibility for the performance of the existing business and must maximise Operating Profit, Return on Investment and Return on Cash from the existing Base Business in the Stockholm area.
   

  

 In addition, the Area Director will have responsibility to grow the business from existing revenues to revenue targets set for next 24 -36 months delivering the required operating margins. The AD will own and execute the growth plan for the area and will recruit and build the necessary team to achieve this objective.
   

  

 The AD will coordinate and work with regional / group functional leaders to execute against set objectives and standards for the area and have ultimate accountability for all the functions within area i.e. Sales, Development, Marketing, Operations, Finance and HR / Team Management.
   

  

 The AD should at all times be looking for innovations to improve the performance of the business and should report these back to Group where they can be considered for implementation across all Regus locations.
   

  

 The remuneration for the AD will include a significant bonus upside directly related to the successful delivery of the performance and growth objectives set for the area.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
***Sales Leadership***
* Ensures consistent growth of quality revenue through development of existing and new sales channels in the area.
* Provides leadership on pricing and sales volume by driving awareness of revenue targets and by measuring and communicating results.
* Partners with the sales team/ key accounts team to penetrate and close new business as required.
* Grows the number of leads generated in the area by the sales team through networking, broker relations and other sales activities.
* Drives the conversion of leads and enquiries in the area into profitable sales.
* Maintains a database of customers, real estate agents and other channels / partnerships. Provides sales mentoring and development of all Area Sales Managers to continually raise the level of sales acumen within the Company.
* In partnership with the regional marketing team develops and executes the area marketing plan to drive brand awareness and enquiries.


***Commercial Management***
* Deliver the Development potential of the Area.
* Maximise the Profit potential and Cash Return from the Area.
* Reviews business performance by sales area and centre focusing on profit and sales. Reviews results versus plan monthly and takes corrective action where necessary.


***Operations and Customer Service***
* Ensures that the Regus operations processes are followed and well executed.
* Drives the delivery of centre readiness and customer service standards across the area.
* Owns customer issue escalation within the area.
* Responsible to deliver customer retention and satisfaction targets set for the area. Drives Customer Service Income Plans for the area.


***Growth***
* Executes the growth and development plan for the area. Develops area specific development strategies to grow the Regus footprint through both conventional and unconventional low risk / low capex models such as franchising / licensing.
* Identifies, selects sites and analyses potential development locations within the area. Identifies landlords or developers for partnership lease opportunities.


***Team Management***
* Recruits, trains, develops, manages, leads and measures productivity of the area team.
* Ensures a visible sales, operations & development leadership presence in the area. Recommends organisation structure as the business evolves
* Communicates Area/Region Objectives and establishes personal objectives for all direct reports and clearly communicates performance expectations.
* Monitors performance and provides feedback/ appraisals and coaching to all direct reports.
* Conducts team meetings and team building events as appropriate.


**Required Skills, Experience & Qualifications**
* A self-motivated leader with a real passion to grow the business and succeed. Commercially focused, results driven with a strong track record of growing a business. Ability to read and interpret the financial statements and reports.
* Proven ability to recruit, train, develop, manage, lead and measure productivity of sales teams.
* Absolute commitment to high ethics and integrity.
* A skilled negotiator and confident commercial decision maker.
* Excellent verbal/written communication skills. Willing to travel for up to 50% of time.


**About The Company**
 IWG has been at the forefront of flexible working for more than 30 years. With over 3,500 locations around the globe, spanning brands including Regus, Spaces, Signature and HQ, we have made it possible for businesses of all sizes to make the transition to hybrid working, empowering employees to work wherever and whenever is most convenient.
   

  

 We help more than 8 million people and their businesses to work more productively, supported by a choice of professional, inspiring and collaborative workspaces, communities and services.
   

  

 As the world’s leading provider of hybrid work solutions, with four times the number of locations compared to its nearest competitor, IWG is already working with over 80% of the Fortune 500 and counts businesses including Amazon, Netflix, EY and Uber amongst its customers.
   

  

 Companies of all sizes are shifting to flexible working to lower costs, improve employee retention and lower their carbon emissions. The flexible workspace is expected to grow by 600% by 2023, when 30% of all office space will be hybrid. We are growing our network faster than ever to keep up with demand from customers as we work towards our goal of reaching 30,000 centres.
   

  

***Carbon Neutral Workplaces***
 IWG’s purpose of helping everyone have a great day at work, while protecting people and the planet is at the heart of everything we do. We are proud to supply all of our customers worldwide with carbon neutral workplaces, and we have a strong climate action plan in place to help us achieve our objective of Net Zero emissions by 2040.
   

  

***Leading Employer Award***
 IWG is proud to be the recipient of a Leading Employer Award in both 2022 and 2023. Awarded exclusively to the top 1% of employers, the accolade is testament to our diverse global workforce and the role everyone plays in bringing our purpose, culture and values to life, every single day.
   

  

 Join us at https://careers.iwgplc.com/home

title: Business Analyst
description:
Gazella rekryterar nu en Business Analyst till Green Storage, ett bolag med höga ambitioner och stark tillväxt. Green Storage fortsätter sin resa mot att bli Nordens ledande aktör inom förrådsbranschen – med ett modernt digitalt erbjudande och ett tydligt fokus på datadrivet arbete. Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och bygga vidare på denna resa med ansvar för att säkerställa datakvalitet, utveckla bolagets rapportplattform och stötta den operativa verksamheten med insiktsdrivna analyser.
 



  





 Rollen som Business Analyst är en ny utökning av teamet där du ges möjlighet att vara med och forma rollen.
 



  





**Vad Green Storage erbjuder dig** 




 Som Business Analyst på Green Storage blir du en del av ett tillväxtbolag med nordisk expansion. Med KPI:er kopplade till digital konvertering, self-service och first-time-resolution driver de konstant förbättring och innovation. Redan idag är deras processer nära 100 % automatiserade, men de är aldrig klara! Du får möjlighet att driva förändring, förbättra arbetssätt och göra verklig skillnad.
 



  





 Green Storage tillämpar kollektivavtal och erbjuder ett marknadsmässigt förmånspaket. Kulturen präglas av engagemang, öppenhet och positiv energi med högt i tak där många skratt är en naturlig del av arbetsdagen. Medarbetarna är stolta över produkten, brinner för sitt arbete och uppmuntras att samarbeta över team- och avdelningsgränser. Hos Green Storage är det viktigt att vara en del av den gemenskap och det driv som finns på kontoret – därför arbetar de tillsammans på plats varje dag på sitt kontor på Lindhagensgatan 126.
 



  





**Din utmaning** 




 Som Business Analyst kommer du att vara en nyckelspelare i deras strävan att skapa en gemensam affärsmodell och rapporteringsstruktur för hela den nordiska portföljen. Du kommer att ha ett helhetsansvar för datalagret (SQL) och arbeta med att ta fram, utveckla och förvalta rapporter i Power BI, ofta i nära dialog med den operativa ledningen och andra nyckelpersoner i verksamheten. Du rapporterar till CTO och arbetar nära både ekonomiavdelningen, marknadsavdelningen och andra centrala funktioner.
 



  





 Dina arbetsuppgifter innebär bland annat:
 



  




* Säkerställa hög kvalitet i datalagret och bakomliggande system.
* Ta fram och vidareutveckla rapporter i Power BI.
* Utföra ad hoc-analyser och ta fram underlag som stöd för affärsbeslut.
* Samarbeta tätt med IT och ekonomi för att skapa effektiva och enhetliga processer.
* Identifiera och driva förbättringsförslag kopplat till uppföljning, prissättning och effektivisering.
* Driva uppbyggnad och vidareutveckling av bolagets rapportplattform.
* Stötta den operativa ledningen med analys och beslutsstöd.
* Fungera som en central länk mellan olika avdelningar.
* Bidra med insikter och analys till marknadsteamet samt andra avdelningar inom organisationen.



  





**Din bakgrund** 




 Vi söker dig som arbetat några år inom controlling och har ett starkt intresse för data, analys och affärsutveckling. Du har en god förståelse för ekonomiska flöden och rapportering men drivs framför allt av att skapa struktur, generera insikter och hitta lösningar. Vi ser att du har en relevant akademisk examen inom ekonomi, antingen från universitet eller yrkeshögskola. Vidare har du god förståelse för databaser och erfarenhet av SQL. Erfarenhet av att bygga rapporter i Power BI är ett stort plus och du har goda kunskaper i Excel. Du har ett starkt intresse för system och hur de kan användas för att skapa affärsvärde.
 



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är framåt och tar för dig, inte rädd för att ta initiativ och driva ditt arbete självständigt. Vidare är du nyfiken och ser värdet i att vara nära verksamheten. Du arbetar systematiskt och noggrant med stort fokus på datakvalitet. Samtidigt är du kreativ och kommer gärna med förslag på hur processer och rapporter kan förbättras. Slutligen är du en lagspelare som bidrar till en positiv och engagerad arbetsmiljö.
 



  





**Om Green Storage** 




 Green Storage är ett snabbväxande företag som revolutionerar self–storage-marknaden i Norden. Sedan 2018 har vi byggt ett 100 % digitalt self–storage-bolag genom egen fastighetsutveckling och strategiska förvärv. Vi har expanderat i Sverige, Norge och Danmark och driver idag cirka 195 anläggningar med en beräknad omsättning på ca 700 miljoner kronor under 2025. Med en nästan helt digital kundresa – från första kontakt till utflytt – ligger vi i framkant när det gäller att förenkla och automatisera kundupplevelsen. Vi mäter framgång i automatik, self-service och datadrivna insikter.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Ansökningar hanteras löpande. Passar du in på ovanstående profil? Ansök redan idag via ansökningsknappen! I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Green Storage med Gazella som partner. Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Julia Zovko (julia.zovko@gazella.se), som är ansvarig rekryterare för denna tjänst.

title: Sustainability Accountant
description:
**Hållbarhetsredovisare** 




  





**Om tjänsten** 




  





*Brinner du för hållbarhet? Med en nära koppling till det lilla samhället på Åland, beläget bland tusentals öar mitt i Östersjön, är det naturligt att hållbarhetsarbetet är en del av Ålandsbankens värdegrund.* 




  





 Brinner du även för rapportering? Till avdelningen Group Finance söker vi nu en Hållbarhetsredovisare som blir en del av vårt team i Group Sustainability. Det är en tillfällig anställning till juli 2026, med eventuell möjlighet till förlängning.
 



  





 Du kommer tillsammans med övriga kollegor i hållbarhetsteamet att ansvara för att utveckla och säkerställa en effektiv hållbarhetsrapportering både externt och internt, proaktivt följa upp nya branschkrav och regulatoriska krav som ställs på hållbarhetsredovisning och säkerställa att hållbarhetsdata är tillförlitlig. Eftersom lagstadgad hållbarhetsrapportering är i en tidig utvecklingsfas kommer även fokus att vara på hantering och implementering av regulatoriska förändringar och utveckling av processer och strukturer inom området.
 



  





 Som en del av Group Sustainability blir du en del av ett engagerat och ambitiöst team som arbetar med hållbarhetsutveckling både ur ett koncernperspektiv och på produktnivå. Du kommer att arbeta nära hela hållbarhetsteamet tillsammans med vår erfarna expert inom hållbarhetsredovisning, CSRD/ESRS och taxonomin. Du kommer även att arbeta i nära kontakt med flera olika delar av organisationen gällande hållbarhetsfrågor och rapportering.
 



  





 Placering i Mariehamn eller Stockholm.
 



  





**Om dig** 




  





 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av hållbarhetsrapportering, helst enligt CSRD/ESRS och/eller taxonomin. Vi ser gärna att du har en utbildning på högskolenivå inom ekonomi och hållbarhet och/eller flera års erfarenhet av redovisning. Möjlighet finns att växa med rollen så tveka inte att söka. Vi förutsätter att du är förtrogen med Excel och har god IT-vana och det är meriterande om du har kunskap eller erfarenhet av rapportering hos finansmarknadsaktörer, ESG-standarder som GHG-protokollet och PCAF eller EU:s regelverk inom Sustainable Finance såsom CSRD eller SFDR.
 



 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet, och som person är du engagerad, noggrann, effektiv och har ett metodiskt arbetssätt. Du motiveras av att uppnå resultat och trivs i en föränderlig miljö. Teamwork är viktigt för oss, så vi förväntar oss att du är en lagspelare och arbetar för en god stämning på avdelningen. Du är bra på att kommunicera samt har förmågan att se till både helhet såväl som till detaljer.
 



  





**Att bli en del av oss** 




  





 Vi erbjuder dig en kul och utmanande arbetsplats i en föränderlig bransch där våra medarbetare står i fokus. Vi har en öppen och flexibel kultur där frihet under ansvar och feedback är några av hörnstenarna. Vi värdesätter utmaningar och drivs av att göra våra kunder och intressenter mer framgångsrika.
 



  





**Att arbeta på Ålandsbanken** 




  





 Här kan du läsa mera om vad vi erbjuder dig som blir en del av laget Ålandsbanken!
 



 https://www.alandsbanken.ax/om-oss/karriar/arbeta-pa-alandsbanken
 



  





**Vill du veta mer?** 




  





 Närmare information om tjänsten får du av Gruppchef Ida Hellgren, tfn +358 204 29011, eller Rekryterare John Boman, john.boman@alandsbanken.fi. Intervjuer sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan senast den 29.06.2025.

title: Customer Success Manager - Supply Chain/Forecasting/Purchasing
description:
**EazyStock**
 EazyStock’s parent company, Syncron, has been specialising in Inventory and Price solutions for enterprise customers for 30years. With customers such as JCB, Mazda and Manitowoc, Syncron is a market leader in their field.
   

  

 EazyStock was set up as a cloud-based forecasting, purchasing and inventory optimisation tool, with the goals of helping customers reduce stock, increase service level, provide dynamic categorisation, and give easily accessible KPI information.
   

  

 We are an entrepreneurial and international team, operating across Europe, Asia, and the USA, developing and selling the best cloud-based inventory optimization solution on the market.
   

  

 The software is best in class, but it is our people that make us special. We hire great people, give them the tools, and then help them to flourish. We are a customer first business who achieve our goals together.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Customer Success Manager (CSM) is the face of the company. It is an exciting and broad role that includes both heading up the implementation of new customers, and providing their long-term guidance to ensure they meet their goals. It is about taking responsibility for your allocated customers and becoming a part of their business. We want you to know what they do, how they do it and how EazyStock can best add long-term value.
   

  

 The CSM is the voice of the customer within the business. Whether this be product development, process improvements or support requirements, you will work cross functionally to ensure needs are met and you will play a major role in how the region evolves to further support their customers.
   

  

 What would you do?
   

  

  

* Attend, contribute to, and eventually lead Discovery Workshops with customers.
* Map customer requirements to EazyStock capabilities.
* Provide user training.
* Hold regular value reviews with all of your customers to ensure they are meeting their goals, understand if their needs are changing and set value targets for upcoming periods.
* Identify functionality gaps, scope solutions, and liaise with Products Team to ensure appropriate development for your customers.
* Potentially create SQL reports to support specific testing use cases.


 Who you are? / What we expect:
   

  

  

* Some demonstrable working experience in at least one of Supply Chain, Purchasing or Forecasting.
* Business English proficient. With evidence of tailoring both verbal and written communication to achieve desired results.
* Clear and concise presentation skills, ability to adapt message depending on audience.
* Ability to teach, train and coach users through their EazyStock journey, identifying different learning methods and adapting your training.
* Desire and ability to keep up to date with news/issues/advancements in technology related to the domain.
* Experience using Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook (or equivalents) in a business environment.
* Business level language skills in English and Swedish


 The icing on the cake:
   

  

  

* Project Management Experience (particularly in Software).
* Experience in a cloud SaaS organisation.
* Experience with cloud Software implementations.
* Customer Success/Account Management experience.


 We offer:
   

  

  

* Structured onboarding training plan.
* Genuinely flexible hybrid working
* Career Progression Model and clear guidance on development, with Customer Success and Management paths to choose from.


**Unsure** 
 if you meet all the job requirements but passionate about the role?
 **Apply anyway!** 
 Syncron values diversity and welcomes all Candidates,
 **even** 
 those with non-traditional backgrounds. We believe in transferable skills and a shared passion for success!
   

  

 The world is changing. Manufacturing companies are shifting from selling products to delivering services. And we are driving this transformation together with our Customers, by helping them reduce costs and manual processes. We are guiding them on their journey towards a fully connected service experience and making their brand stronger.
   

  

**Our go** 
**al: to make the complex simple.**
 Visit syncron.com to get to know us better!
   

  

 If you encounter any case of potential ethical or laws violations, you may submit a report to a dedicated Syncron Whistleblowing Platform here.
   

  

 You may request Syncron Whistleblowing Procedure via the „ask a question” tab available here.

title: Senior Manager, Open Banking, Europe Government Engagement
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 The Senior Manager, Government Engagement is a full-time role which can be based in Sweden (Stockholm), Germany (Frankfurt or Berlin) or Netherlands (Amsterdam), and will report to the VP, Europe Government Engagement, based in the UK. Some travel in the region will be required from time to time.
   

  





 This role is focused on Government Engagement (GE) across the Visa Europe region. It requires strong collaboration with GE market leads and subject matter experts across the Europe region on linked initiatives, and works in close coordination with the GE team in Brussels. The role may also provide industry expertise and support to global colleagues as required.
   

  





 The role supports wider GE strategies, including providing support for executives to execute strategic engagement with Governments across the region, and helping to ensure that policy frameworks are conducive to a fair, competitive and successful operating environment for current and future business.
   

  





 Headline objectives of the role are:
   

  




* Strengthen leadership in the marketplace, increasing impact on government policy to enable the Visa 2030 corporate strategy.
* Directly and through relevant colleagues, nurture reputation in priority local markets through cultivating long-term, trusted relationships with critical government and regulatory stakeholders and by promoting Visa/Tink as a constructive partner to enable growth.
* Seek to safeguard “right-to-play”, as an enabler of the Visa 2030 corporate strategy, through the identification and execution of engagement strategies.
* In alignment with the GE strategies and relevant market priorities, execute strategic client engagement focused on adding qualitative and meaningful value to the business relationships.
* Promote a culture that maintains the highest degree of collaboration, integrity, inclusion and accountability.



 What we expect of you, day to day:
   

  





 VISA AS A CRITICAL PARTNER:
   

  




* Produce a Government account plan on Open Banking in close collaboration with GE leads and hub colleagues.
* Create and execute opportunities to demonstrate the value of Visa/Tink across the region to Government partners, in lockstep with local cluster/regional GE leads.
* Execute strategic presence and representation at important political, policy and industry events in priority markets, alongside and in consultation with GE colleagues and corporate affairs functions as appropriate.



 SUPPORT CORE BUSINESS AND GROWTH:
   

  




* Proactively monitor the external political and policy environment.
* Identify, assess and seek to address major risks to business objectives, alongside other functions, and co-ordinate/manage preparations of our positions and responses.
* In collaboration with GE colleagues, regulatory policy and legal, work alongside the business to support growth ambitions.



 DRIVE CLIENT VALUE:
   

  




* Partner with priority client directors, country managers and RMDs to gain a deep understanding of top client priorities.
* In alignment with client directors, country managers and RMDs, undertake systematic, ongoing GE engagement with key clients, as dictated by GE priorities and strategies.
* Seek to identify opportunities to showcase GE credentials and skillset to add value to the business relationship with clients.
* Work in alignment with Government Solutions to help position Visa/Tink as a partner to Governments.



 Additional Requirements:
   

  




* Work constructively in different markets with other functions, across the regional and global environment, in a matrix environment.
* Share know how and expertise with GE counterparties in other Regions.
* Help drive the continuous enhancement of function, toolkit and staff.
* Support open, timely and targeted communication with executives to ensure awareness of main regulatory, policy and engagement developments and strategy to protect the business and reputation.
* Maintain a relentless focus on the bigger picture, adopting a strategic approach.
* Promote diversity and inclusion in all engagements.



 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**
* Demonstrable experience in
 **Open Banking essential** 
 and in push payments very desirable – in a relevant position of Government or industry engagement or consultancy
* Proven experience of senior executive engagement and managing upwards
* Very strong collaborator required
* Proven strategic advocacy skills
* Good inter-personal skills and stakeholder management experience
* Excellent written and spoken communication including presentation abilities
* Strong digital services and/or technology interest desirable
* Strong analytical skills
* Ability to act independently and flexibly within a multi-disciplinary matrixed team
* A relevant degree in Politics, Economics or Law is desirable, but not essential


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Artificial Intelligence Analytics Architect - Flexible Location
description:
**Artificial Intelligence Analytics Architect**
 Our talented Data & AI Practice is made up of globally recognized experts - and there’s room for more analytical and ambitious data professionals. If you’re passionate about helping clients make better data-driven decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, let’s talk. Take your skills to a new level and launch a career where you can truly do what matters.
   

  

**Come join us**
**Come join us**
 As an Artificial Intelligence Analytics Architect, you will bring expert-level knowledge in support of sales motions and project execution across Avanade's Data & AI portfolio. We are looking for SME who brings deep engineering experience and a strategic mindset to design, build, and operationalize enterprise AI and machine learning solutions—particularly those involving large language models (LLMs), agentic systems and operationalization of AI/ML systems. This role requires a deep understanding of AI/ML technologies, cloud platforms, and the ability to translate complex business requirements into scalable, production-ready solutions for our clients.
   

  

**Skills And Experiences**
**Skills and experiences**
**AI & ML Architecture:** 
 Proven experience architecting end-to-end solutions across the ML and LLM lifecycle—from data ingestion and model training to inference, monitoring, and continuous improvement.
   

  

**Strategic & Business Alignment:** 
 Ability to balance technical feasibility with business value, driving adoption of AI technologies that align with organizational priorities and customer needs.
   

  

**Cloud & Data Ecosystems:** 
 Deep familiarity with Azure and with tools like Azure Functions, AKS, Event Hubs, Spark, for scalable, real-time architectures.
   

  

**Programming & Tools Proficiency:** 
 Strong working knowledge in Programming/scripting languages, i.e., Python/Java, Scala, SQL, and experience across machine learning and deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow).
   

  

**Deployment & MLOps:** 
 Understanding of modern MLOps practices, including containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), CI/CD pipelines, and observability tools.
   

  

**LLMs and Agentic Systems:** 
 Experience building solutions using LLMs, with practical understanding of prompt engineering, semantic search, tool usage, and orchestrated multi-agent workflows.
   

  

**Communication & Leadership:** 
 Ability to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders, lead architecture reviews, and represent AI strategy in cross-functional conversations.
   

  

**Continuous Learning:** 
 Strong curiosity and drive to stay current with the latest AI research, technologies, and tools—and apply that knowledge to build smarter, more effective solutions.
   

  

**About You**
**About you**
**Characteristics That Can Spell Success For This Role**
* Consultative, collaborative, curious
* Resilient, adaptable, flexible
* Humble leader, master negotiator, relationship builder
* Passionate about tech and engaging with and advising clients


**What You'll Do**
**What you’ll do**
**Architect Scalable AI Solutions:** 
 Design and optimize end-to-end ML and LLM systems—including traditional ML, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and agentic AI architectures—that serve real-time and batch workloads at enterprise scale.
   

  

**Build and Operationalize Production Systems:** 
 Lead implementation of production-ready AI solutions using tools such as Azure ML, Databricks, and Azure AI Foundry, ensuring performance, reliability, security, and compliance.
   

  

**Define Best Practices and Frameworks:** 
 Collaborate with solution architects, engineers, and data scientists to set architecture standards, delivery frameworks, and reusable components that enable consistent, high-quality AI deployments.
   

  

**Mentor and Enable Teams:** 
 Coach junior engineers and architects, lead technical reviews, and foster a culture of innovation and engineering excellence across AI teams at Avanade.
   

  

**Drive Continuous Innovation:** 
 Stay current with advancements in AI/ML and integrate them into enterprise architectures to future-proof solutions.
   

  

**Learn more**
 To learn more about Avanade, please visit https://www.avanade.com/
   

  

**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year, with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you


  

  

 Find out more about some of our benefits Employee Benefits at Avanade | Avanade
   

  

**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live.
