title: Compensation Consulting Analyst
company_industry: Insurance and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Mercer is hiring a Compensation Consulting Analyst** 
 to join our Stockholm office. In this role, you will support leading multinational clients in Sweden by delivering expert advice on total rewards strategies. As part of our team, you will contribute to projects across compensation and benefits, helping clients design programs that attract, retain, and engage talent.
   

  

 The Swedish Rewards Team at Mercer helps organizations design and implement reward strategies that align with business goals and talent needs. We advise on e.g. executive compensation, career and remuneration frameworks, incentive design, and pay-for-performance models. Using Mercer’s proprietary data, global benchmarks, and analytical tools, we help clients navigate complex market trends, regulatory requirements, and evolving employee expectations. Our work often connects with broader talent strategies such as job architecture, pay transparency, and workforce transformation.
   

  

 This is a hybrid position that requires at least three days per week in the office.
 **Please apply ensuring your CV is in English.**
**We will count on you to:**
* Analyze compensation and financial data, and benchmark it against market trends using tools such as Excel and Mercer’s proprietary databases and tools.
* Manage and validate client submissions to Mercer’s compensation surveys, ensuring accuracy and high-quality data input.
* Ensure accuracy of market data and contribute to high-quality client deliverables through collaboration with internal teams.
* Create clear, data-driven exhibits to support client insights and recommendations.
* Conduct research on reward practices, pay transparency, and talent trends using public and proprietary sources.
* Prepare presentations and reports with high-quality output that communicate findings and recommendations clearly and professionally to clients.
* Support the design of job architecture, pay structures, and incentive programs that align with client strategy and compliance needs.
* Contribute to client relationship-building through event support, day-to-day communication, and coordination.
* Support proposal development and business development activities


**What you need to have:**
* An undergraduate degree with less than 3 years of professional experience.
* Strong organisational skills with the ability to independently initiate and complete tasks.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and Swedish, adaptable to different audiences and levels of seniority.
* An analytical mindset and confidence in making data-driven decisions based on logical reasoning.
* Strong time management skills to effectively manage responsibilities in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* A commercial mindset and interest in client work.


**What makes you stand out:**
* Experience using Excel and PowerPoint to analyze data, build compensation exhibits, and develop clear, client-ready presentations using functions such as VLOOKUP, pivot tables, and structured slide design.
* Flexibility and willingness to take on projects with little notice and participate in meetings outside of standard business hours.
* A proactive approach to learning and adapting to new challenges in the compensation consulting field.
* Detail orientated with a high personal ambition to ensure high-quality deliveries at all times


**Why join our team?**
* Opportunity to work with a global industry leader
* A collaborative and inclusive work environment that values diversity and promotes professional growth.
* Competitive salary and benefits package. Ongoing training and development opportunities to enhance your skills and knowledge.
* Access to Mercer's global knowledge and resources


 Mercer, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a global leader in helping clients realize their investment objectives, shape the future of work and enhance health and retirement outcomes for their people. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit mercer.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.
   

  

 Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
   

  

 Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.
   

  

**R\_305349**

title: Electrical Solution Architect (Battery & Solar PV Systems)
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1300+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

 About the role:
   

  

 Our product development department is growing. We are now looking for a Electrical Solution Architect who will own our Energy Generation & Storage category.
   

  

 In this role, you will work in the cross-section between hardware and software development, owning the overall systems architecture for all products within this category.
   

  

 You will take technical ownership of projects from concept to implementation. This includes ensuring we set the right technical requirements to ensure we meet our customers’ needs, working with the right partners to bring the system to life, and improving on the status quo to ensure we design the strongest end-to-end home energy management system on the market.
   

  

 The role is based in Stockholm and will involve close collaboration with our different central product development teams, as well as with our customer-facing teams out in each of our markets.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing:
   

  

  

* Take technical ownership of our Energy Generation & Storage category (PV, inverters, batteries, EV charging solutions).
* Develop the systems architecture and ensure seamless integration (of both software and hardware) with our larger ecosystem of e.g. heating products.
* Be the technical subject matter expert who bridges the technical roadmap with our customers and business needs.
* Work with partners to develop our solutions, and help decide what we do in-house and via third parties.
* Generate documentation of system setup, roadmap, requirements, decisions & solutions.
* Follow up on performance and ensure we evolve our portfolio based on data & insights.
* Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies.
* Keywords: Electrical system design, System Requirement Management, Prototype testing, Standards and Certification process, Technical documentation, Industrialization technical interface, Supplier technical interface, Designers and Field expert training - 3rd line support.


 What you’ll bring to the role:
   

  

  

* Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, renewable energy, or equivalent.
* Proven experience as a Solution Architect or similar within power electronics, preferably having previously worked with either battery or solar PV products.
* Demonstrated expertise in systems architecture, technical road mapping, and product development lifecycle.


 Additionally, we value:
   

  

  

* A proactive, entrepreneurial mindset and ability to manage in a fast-changing environment.
* Quick learning abilities and a solution-oriented approach.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Confidence to challenge the wider team to ensure we are always asking the right questions.
* Willingness to engage with a wide array of stakeholders to collect information, share expertise, and be a source of inspiration for what is possible to achieve our goals.


 What is in it for you?
   

  

  

* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan subway station just a few minutes walk away.


 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively.
   

  

 We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Master Data Senior Analyst – Procure to Pay
description:
Join AniCura as a Master Data Senior Analyst – Procure to Pay and play a key role in shaping data excellence across our European finance systems. You’ll drive automation, ensure data integrity, and help power our digital finance transformation in a collaborative, purpose-driven environment.
   

  

**About AniCura**
 AniCura is a family of well-known animal hospitals and clinics specialized in veterinary care for companion animals. AniCura provides modern, high-quality veterinary care for pets at over 500 practices in 17 European countries and creates peace of mind for pet owners through excellent access and patient safety. AniCura has a turnover of around $1B with the aspiration to expand business through a combination of organic growth and new hospital acquisitions. Every year, AniCura’s 12,000 passionate professionals attend to three million companion animal patients. Since 2018, AniCura has been a part of Mars Veterinary Health, a family-owned company focused on veterinary care.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 The Master Data Senior Analyst plays a pivotal role in maintaining data integrity and standardization across the Procure-to-Pay (P2P) function. Operating within a multinational, shared services environment, this role ensures the harmonization of master data across key platforms such as Oracle, APRO, ACIP, and Banking. By supporting seamless collaboration with our outsourcing partner (DXC) and enabling efficient, automated processes, the role underpins the operational effectiveness of the broader P2P landscape.
   

  

 As part of the European P2P structure, the Master Data Senior Analyst serves as a key liaison between operational teams, system owners, and DXC, ensuring that master data is optimized to support integration, accurate processing, and end-to-end process automation across markets.
   

  

 Reporting directly to the Head of P2P Europe, the role demands a blend of analytical expertise, meticulous attention to detail, and strong stakeholder engagement to drive data-driven excellence and continuous improvement.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Own and govern the P2P master data domain, ensuring consistency, accuracy, and completeness across all relevant systems (Oracle, APRO, ACIP, Banking platforms).
* Design and implement data validation rules, quality controls, and governance frameworks to standardize processes across countries and legal entities.
* Collaborate with internal finance teams, IT, and DXC to ensure master data aligns with automation and integration requirements.
* Continuously improve master data maintenance processes to increase reliability, scalability, and audit readiness.
* Analyze existing data landscapes, identify discrepancies or inefficiencies, and lead harmonization efforts.
* Ensure timely and controlled master data changes with clear accountability and audit trails.
* Provide insights and reporting on data quality metrics, supporting the improvement of end-to-end P2P process performance.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders to promote adherence to data standards and foster a data-driven culture across the organization.


**Summary Of The Role**
* Job Title: Master Data Senior Analyst – Procure to Pay
* Department: Finance
* Reports To: Head of P2P Europe
* Location: Netherlands preferred, with flexibility for other AniCura locations across Europe.
* Contract: Full-time
* Languages: Fluency in English (additional European languages are a plus)
* Key Stakeholders: Finance Teams, IT, Outsourcing Partner (DXC), Local Market Operations


**Qualifications & Experience**
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in finance, Business Information Systems, Data Management, or a related discipline.
* Professional certifications in data management, governance, or ERP platforms (e.g., Oracle) are a strong advantage.
* Minimum of 4 years of experience in a finance or data-centric role, preferably within a shared services or multinational organization.
* Demonstrated success in implementing master data governance frameworks and driving process standardization.
* Practical experience with ERP and financial systems—particularly Oracle—and familiarity with automation and digital finance tools.
* In-depth knowledge of Procure-to-Pay (P2P) processes and the critical role of master data quality in operational efficiency.
* Excellent interpersonal and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to influence cross-functional teams across Finance, IT, and third-party partners.


**Our offer:**
* Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to shape the future of veterinary care, together.
* An industry competitive salary and benefits package
* A stimulating work environment with good opportunities for personal development
* Freedom to take responsibility and the opportunity to influence
* Flexible working hours, hybrid working, international, digital work environment
* Learning and development opportunities
* The opportunity to cuddle our beloved 4-legged friends in our offices.
* We are always open for a conversation to discuss your individual needs.


**If this sounds like you**
 Please contact
 **Lekya Kanamarlapudi, Group Corporate Recruiter** 
 , who is happy to tell you more about this opportunity and the recruitment process. Or apply by submitting your resume through clicking the apply button below.
   

  

**AniCura is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from candidates with diverse backgrounds.**
**Internal Candidates/Associates:** 
 If you are interested in this position, please reach out to the Corporate Recruiter to understand the internal recruitment guidelines.

title: (Senior) Consultant Financial Risk (f|m|x)
description:
zeb is one of the leading strategy, management and IT consultancies specializing in financial services in Europe. We support banks, insurance companies and (tech) service providers in dealing with all the challenges and opportunities arising from transformation in the industry.
   

  

 Your tasks:
   

  

 Dependent on your seniority level your daily tasks will conclude in:
   

  

* Take an active role working on high-profile international projects with clients.
* Solve complex real-world quantitative challenges.
* Work with complex data sets developing risk models and analytics tools.
* Support senior colleagues in their daily client work, e.g. write management reports, perform controls, financial reporting, attend client meetings.
* Development of internal projects.
* Development of presentation material.
* Deep dive analysis within a broad range of topics required for senior colleagues.


 Your skills:
   

  

* Academic degree (MSc or PhD) in a quantitative subject such as Mathematics/Financial mathematics, Physics, Computer Science etc with a solid academic record from a top tier university.
* Earlier part-time jobs/internships at a management consulting firm and/or a financial service company.
* Strong interest in finance.
* Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to build trust with colleagues, stakeholders, and partners.
* Good communication skills with the ability to present information, insights and conclusions in a credible way to various stakeholder.
* Knowledge of the Microsoft office package (Excel, Powerpoint) or with a desire to learn.
* Programming skills in Python or other quantitative language.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills (fluent in English and Swedish). A plus but not a must: Additional European language, preferably German. #jobspreader


**Your Benefits**
* Insurances & Pension Schemes: Safely on the road with zeb—in Germany, you are also privately insured via a group accident insurance policy. For business trips abroad, there is an additional travel health insurance and you can also take out a company pension plan with zeb.
* Job & Family: Do you have questions about the compatibility of consulting and raising a family? In the workingparents@zeb network you will find support and answers.
* Mobile Work: Thanks to our technical equipment, remote work is possible from anywhere – regardless of whether you are on the train, at home or in the office.
* zeb.life: Your life is changing—and we would like to accompany you through the different phases. zeb.life offers you support for example in childcare, life situation management and eldercare or in finding concierge services.


 Equal opportunities for all: we welcome applications from people of all backgrounds – regardless of age, disability, ethnicity, nationality, gender, religion, sexual identity or social background. As an employer, we rely on people who like to try new things, take responsibility and inspire others through their actions.

title: Lead Account Executive – Stockholm (Sweden)
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Financial Services
description:

title: Fixed Asset Accountant
description:
We're looking for a talented individual to join our Finance team as the Asset Accountant. This is your chance to take on a pivotal role in a vibrant and fast-paced environment. If you're ready to make a significant impact and be part of an innovative team, this opportunity is for you!
 



  





**What you will be doing…** 




  




* Overall responsibility for accounting and reporting for several legal entities as well as accounting processes
* Monthly, quarterly and annual closing according to IFRS and Swedish accounting rules
* Responsible for VAT and tax management in cooperation with the company's tax advisors
* Preparing and conducting audit work
* Annual reports and CIT returns according to Swedish GAAP
* Ongoing work on improvements and streamlining together with your colleagues in the finance function
* Treasury and cash management
* Support towards other finance and operations teams



  





**What skills, experience, and knowledge will you need to be successful?** 



* You have a minimum of 3-5 years of experience in accounting
* University degree in business or economics
* You are used to and enjoy working at a fast pace and working towards deadlines
* English and Swedish in speech and writing is a requirement
* Knowledge of Swedish GAAP
* Experience from international organizations and IFRS is an advantage
* You have good knowledge of Excel as well as experience from ERP systems (URW uses SAP)
* Previous experience from real estate is an advantage



  





  





**Who are we?** 




 At Unibail-Rodamco-Westfield (URW), we develop and operate a portfolio of sustainable, premium, mixed-use real estate assets across Europe and the United States. Driven by our purpose to Reinvent Being Together, we are committed to accelerating urban regeneration and rethinking how we live together in cities. Today, 2,000 dedicated individuals are working together to reshape the future of real estate and shopping centers by creating innovative, engaging spaces that truly redefine community connections.
 



  





 Our flagship destinations are more than just places; they're the heartbeat of the community. We empower our employees to make a real impact through volunteering, DE&I programs, and leading ESG efforts. URW is at the forefront of experiential entertainment, constantly pushing boundaries to craft unforgettable in-person and digital experiences. By surprising and delighting our customers, we create magical moments and reinvent togetherness in every interaction.
 



  





 Within our Northern Europe Region - spanning the Netherlands, Denmark, Sweden, and the UK - we own and manage eight exceptional assets. These include Westfield Mall of the Netherlands, Stadshart Amstelveen, Westfield London, and Westfield Stratford City.
 



  





**As an international company, our primary internal language is English. Therefore, we kindly ask that you submit your application and resume in English.** 




  





**Why work for us:** 




 We put people's development and learning at the heart of what we do. We'll help you master your role, build your technical skills, and take advantage of top-notch management and leadership programs. From face-to-face workshops to our global online learning resources, we encourage you to make learning a part of your daily routine.
 



  





 We offer a fantastic bonus scheme, and many other incentives, including company health insurance is available at a reduced tariff.
 



  





 Want to know more about what it's like working at URW? Visit our site
 
 https://www.urw.com/join-us/life-at-urw
 




  





**What Matters to Us:** 




 At URW, our purpose is to
 **Reinvent Being Together** 
 , reimagining how people and communities connect, socialise, and experience dynamic moments in unique and meaningful ways.
 



  





 We are proud to promote equal opportunities and embrace diversity in profiles, experiences, and skills. At URW, we believe that diversity is the cornerstone of our success, and we are dedicated to fostering an environment that respects, values, celebrates, and leverages individual differences to their fullest potential.
 



  





 We evaluate each application with fairness and without discrimination based on disability, age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected characteristics. Our commitment is to provide equal access to our services for everyone. If you require any adjustments for your interview, please let us know in advance, so we can support you accordingly.
 



  





**Join us and be part of a team that's making a real difference in your local communities!**

title: Trade Compliance Specialist
description:
**Passionate people create exceptional things**
 Did you know that the solutions we develop are a key part of most industries? Electronics, medical research, renewable energy, food production, infrastructure and many more. We´re everywhere! Working with us means working with the latest technologies and groundbreaking, sustainable innovations. With our inclusive and caring environment, you get the support and inspiration you need to grow. Here, your ideas are embraced, and you never stop learning. Interested in being part of our team?
 **Join us on our journey for a better tomorrow.**
 As Trade Compliance Specialist, you are working in a team of 2 people, reporting to the Trade Compliance Lead. You will be responsible for export and import compliance policies and procedures within Atlas Copco Industrial Technique, ITBA.
   

  

 The position emphasizes import/export compliance issues that may arise and includes interaction with internal legal counsel and government officials as well as cooperation with R&D, sourcing, production units and customer centers.
   

  

 The position involves day-to-day work as well as work of strategic nature.
   

  

**Mission/Responsibilities**
* Continue to develop and improve the Internal Compliance Program, including export/import policies and procedures for ITBA
* Make sure exports/imports take place compliantly, meeting corporate compliance standards as well as legal requirements.
* Conduct regular assessments to identify risks and corrective actions
* Analyze, monitor, communicate and implement updates in customs legislations and international trade legislations
* Drive change management within ITBA on global trade compliance through education of other functions
* Develop a Trade Compliance Training Program including developing and delivering training packages
* Provide advisory support to ensure that all applicable items are classified for export and import in accordance to existing regulations e.g. Country of Origin, HS codes and ECCNs
* Export license determination and applications
* Screening against Denied Party Listing


**Knowledge/Experience**
* You have approximately 5 years’ work experience within trade compliance.
* Strong working knowledge and experience applying EU/US or other international customs and export control laws and regulations, familiar with HS, ECCN and sanction classifications.
* Experience of working with Denied Party Screening.
* Demonstrated ability to focus on project work and efficiently bring projects to completion.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills (Swedish and English).
* Advanced experience with MS Office, specifically MS Excel.
* SAP GTS knowledge and experience is a plus


**Educational Requirements**
 A completed Bachelor’s/Master Degree or similar in a relevant field (International Business and Trade, Logistics, etc.).
   

  

**Personality Requirements**
 As a person you are structured with attention to details and are having strong analytical skills. You are a flexible team player and motivator with leadership skills and ability to lead and train cross-functional teams. Furthermore you are self-driven with proven ability to work on multiple tasks and must possess ability to make sound judgments with confidence.
   

  

**What You Can Expect From Us**
 At Atlas Copco, we have a friendly, family-like atmosphere and a culture known for respectful interaction, ethical behavior and integrity. We offer opportunities to grow and develop, as well as potential to see your ideas realized and make an impact. As part of the Atlas Copco Group, you have access to global job opportunities.
   

  

 Listen to our co-workers what it is like to work for Atlas Copco Industrial Technique. You find a 15 min podcast here (in Swedish): Co-workers about their job in Atlas Copco
   

  

**Additional Information**
 Our office is situated in Sickla, Stockholm.
   

  

 The selection process will be ongoing and the position may be filled before the last application date, so don't hesitate to apply!
   

  

**Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice**
 Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.

title: Senior Principal, Analyst - Oracle Software and SaaS Licensing (Location: REMOTE - EUROPE)
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Research Services
description:
You will work with an incredible organization and as part of a diverse, multicultural global team to amplify your impact in an intellectually stimulating and fun environment with ample career and personal growth potential. The Software & Cloud Negotiation Practice within the Sourcing, Procurement and Vendor Management group is at the forefront of Gartner’s dedication to helping clients understand and achieve cost-effective, commercially optimized software and cloud licensing deals. You will develop a deep understanding of client roles , priorities and challenges. You will become a trusted advisor of such clients and deliver actionable, objective insights that help them make faster, smarter decisions and perform strongly on their mission-critical priorities. Our thought leadership allows us to “see around corners,” anticipate changes in technology and capabilities and how those will impact our clients’ initiatives.
   

  

**The Position**
 Gartner Analysts are innately curious, industry thought leaders who create expert research while bringing best practices and research models to life across a broad range of client organizations. Senior Principal, Analysts are a trusted source of actionable, objective advice. They deepen personal value for clients every day by providing high quality, timely insight and must-have-research - content that is provocative and pragmatic. They meet with clients daily via virtual meetings or face-to-face interactions. They promote a clear vision for the evolving markets at the local, regional and global levels. To support these conversations you will research markets, practices and trends as well as produce written or digital research for Gartner clients to apply.
   

  

**The Role**
 The successful candidate has expertise in software- and cloud services contracting and negotiation. This should include experience in negotiating, primarily with Oracle but preferably with additional experience with other large software and cloud providers. The candidate should bring an understanding of Oracle’s (and other vendors’) major programs, contracting models and pricing / discounting approaches for both on-premise and cloud. They should have a good grasp of nuances of software- and cloud terms and conditions, how they are typically negotiated and their financial impact. They should understand not only how to negotiate effectively with Oracle (and other vendors) but also what key areas of the contracts are typically negotiable and to what extent.
   

  

 The successful candidate has a background in software- and cloud licenses, technology procurement category management, software asset management, or related leadership roles within a buying organization, consulting firm, reseller or vendor. This should be augmented by an understanding and curiosity about the larger business impact of new technology and business trends on software and cloud contracting models and costs, and how to navigate these successfully.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
 The successful candidate will have experience and knowledge to guide Gartner clients in buying and negotiating on-premises software- and cloud deals. As part of a broader, collaborative team, they will conduct their own research in contract negotiation best- and next practices, especially for Oracle, but can expand beyond to neighboring fields as required. They will also guide clients on the commercial impact of new technologies and business trends on existing software license and service portfolios. In addition, the responsibilities of the successful candidate will include:
   

  

* Analyze on-premises / cloud proposals and guide buyers with corresponding negotiation strategy, pricing and contracting
* Conduct innovative, fact-based, must-have research and analysis around client key initiatives and specific areas of expertise, enabling our clients to successfully address their more critical priorities
* Collaborate on and help drive a body of published research and develop a following in the industry as a subject matter expert
* Provide high quality and timely peer review of other analysts’ research
* Lead or participate in research meetings to discuss research issues and collaborate effectively with peers in a diverse, multicultural global team
* Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across teams of analysts
* Cover the specified area as well as applicable adjacent areas, while maintaining a view across a broad spectrum of the market to produce thought-leading, impactful, analytically-deep, fact-based research. Remain ahead of the curve on developments within these specified areas, as well as applicable adjacent areas
* Be relaxed and adept in engaging C-Level executives as well as front-line sourcing and procurement personnel competently and convincingly, while establishing and growing a strong, trusting relationship
* Create materials for clients, delivered in person, via video conference or webinar
* Proactively support Gartner analysts and other internal stakeholders across relevant research key initiatives and on client calls
* Maintain a high client focus with a view to progressively and relentlessly improving the customer experience for Gartner clients
* Help drive proactive engagement and help clients/prospects make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business


**Qualifications, Skills & Experience:**
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience; Graduate degree preferred
* 8-10 years experience. Minimum 5 years of relevant field- or industry experience
* Recent experience with hands-on negotiation experience, negotiation strategies, software license compliance risk assessment, management and/or mitigation in software audit context at minimum with Oracle (= within last 12 months). Experience with larger, complex solutions (software and services) deal negotiation experience is preferred.
* Exceptional analytical skills; ability to apply conceptual models, recognizing patterns and drawing and defending conclusions. Proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data; can effectively apply patterns and frameworks to client challenges and demonstrate learning agility
* Strong market research skills, proven in a procurement, asset management or negotiator role
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively, supporting the workflow of others, in a diverse, multicultural global team
* Strong project planning / management / organizational skills; ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality material
* Strong written and verbal interaction; ability to engage clients and respond effectively to questions. Ability to distill and explain complex ideas articulately, succinctly and effectively
* Excellent presentation skills. Ability to perform well on-stage as well as in smaller groups, face to face
* Strong business and financial acumen
* Demonstrates executive presence; can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders in strategic procurement
* Subject matter expert comfortable with presenting at large- and small-scale speaking engagements
* Exceptional coaching, influencing and leadership skills
* Flexible thinker adept at change and experienced navigating highly matrixed environments
* Innate curiosity and interest in related fields.


 #Remote
   

  

**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:97116
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy

title: Business Controller
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 As Business Controller, you will be part of our
 **global** 
 Business Controlling team and focus on supply chain at the
 **group** 
 level, including Rehadapt team. You will manage and optimize financial performance through forecasting, budgeting, and reporting, ensuring accuracy and reliability.
   

  

 By analyzing results and working closely with Operations Managers, Supply Chain, and Sourcing teams, you’ll provide strategic insights to support decision-making and improve the efficiency of Dynavox Group's supply chain operations. You will play a key role in ensuring that all business activities—from order to delivery—are planned and executed in line with Dynavox Group’s financial objectives, policies, processes, and accounting standards.
   

  

 To thrive in this role, your ability to stay
 **calm** 
 and
 **focused** 
 in times of uncertainty and change will be essential. If you're a driven finance professional who enjoys being a
 **trusted business partner** 
 and turning numbers into clear reports and insights, this is a great opportunity for you!
   

  

**Please note:** 
 This role is
 **onsite** 
 at our office in Stockholm city.
   

  

**In this role you will:**
* Support management in identifying production bottlenecks, defining KPIs, implementing KPIs and financial impacts.
* Monitor, analyze, and report on cost deviations and price fluctuations in components and materials in Operations.
* Contributing to Sales and Operations planning process (S&OP).
* Optimize inventory levels and reduce waste.
* Conduct demand, supply, and inventory forecasting and sensitivity analyses.


**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone that has:
   

  

* Equivalent of +5 years of business controlling experience (a great merit if in production, supply chain or logistics areas)
* Equivalent of a bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics, business, or a related field.
* Analytical skills and advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (including Power Query) is required
* Ability to effectively communicate financial information and analysis to stakeholders at all levels of the organization is required.
* Professional fluency in spoken and written English is required. Swedish is a merit.
* Project management skills are a merit.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Senior Sourcing Specialist
description:
**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Senior Sourcing Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring tactical sourcing services are provided in a timely and high-quality manner, leading independently RfX, negotiations, and contracting for small value projects, and optimizing Source to Pay processes. You will also be involved managing selected tactical categories, and supporting Procurement/Category Managers in various tasks. For this role, you can be located in either Espoo or Solna.
   

  

 Your responsibilities:
   

  

  

* Ensure tactical sourcing services are provided with operational efficiency.
* Lead independently RfX, negotiations, and contracting for small value projects, aligning with strategic sourcing to obtain best value (price, quality, delivery, etc.).
* Contribute to optimizing Source to Pay processes and developing procurement systems.
* Report volumes, performance, and selected KPIs.
* Ensure high performance, tracked by selected KPIs.
* Manage selected tactical categories.
* Create strategy and plans for tactical categories.
* Standardize processes and executions of services, contributing to and/or implementing development initiatives to improve efficiency.
* Provide analytical support needed for planning using statistical tools.
* Maintain open communication with business representatives, procurement community, and suppliers regarding progress, results, and performance.
* Ensure proficient execution throughout the sourcing process.
* Communicate and build relationships with suppliers and monitor supplier performance to support the SRM process.
* Establish strong partnerships with stakeholders and ensure cross-functional collaboration.


**About You**
 To succeed and thrive in this role, we see that you have:
   

  

  

* Several years of experience in the procurement/supply management field in addition to an academic or higher vocational degree.
* Proven track record of leading sourcing project execution, negotiations and contracting.
* Ability to work independently and manage several projects simultaneously.
* Awareness of technical and legal requirements.
* Proficient in IT systems and office tools (e.g., Excel and PowerPoint).
* Active and self-initiative person with good teamwork and time-management skills, and the ability to coordinate and lead a team in projects.
* Good communication skills and ability to create content for different purposes (e.g., reports, trainings, and instructions).
* Full working profiency in English and Swedish, Finnish is considered as an advantage.


**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application latest on
 **16th of June 2025** 
 . We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact Katariina Flinkman at katariina.flinkman@fortum.com.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: HR Manager GCO and Employee Experience
description:
**Ready for a tasty job? We are now looking for a**
**HR Manager GCO and Employee Experience to join our team in Stockholm**
 Do you want to contribute to Fazer's continued development and growth? As a HR Manager for our Global Commercial Organization (GCO) and employee experience, you’ll act as an advisor to business leaders, providing HR support across all aspects of the employee lifecycle. You’ll run initiatives that foster a positive, engaging, and high-performing workplace, while championing employee satisfaction, development, and well-being.
   

  

 This role covers a broad HR scope including workforce planning, employee relations, talent acquisition, performance management, and change support. You’ll also lead local engagement strategies, support onboarding and offboarding, and drive talent and leadership development. A key part of your role is ensuring compliance, promoting a culture of inclusivity, and continuously enhancing the employee experience.
   

  

**What will you bring to the team?**
* 3-5 years of experience, in an HRBP or HR Generalist role.
* Understanding of HR functions, labor laws, and HR best practices.
* Excellent communication, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data interpretation.
* Project management skills with a keen eye for detail and organization.
* Creative problem-solving abilities and a proactive mindset.
* Familiarity with HR systems and digital tools that enhance employee engagement.


 To thrive in this role, we see that you enjoy working in an environment with an open atmosphere. You will be part of a tight team that works across boundaries and is ready to help wherever needed. You are a curious and collaborative team player with a pragmatic approach who readily adapts to changes.
   

  

**Why choose Fazer?**
 It all starts with the people. You’ll join a global HR team of professional, supportive, and development-minded colleagues who inspire one another to grow and succeed. We offer you a key role in advancing Fazer’s people priorities and making a real impact on the business. We’re passionate about what we do — and about finding the right person to grow with us.
   

  

 We at Fazer want to provide a culture of diversity and inclusiveness where all employees can experience an equal working community with a motivating, respectful and safe work environment. In the team, there will be the right balance of challenges and rewarding projects to provide a platform also for individual development.
   

  

**Ready for a tasty job? Apply now.**
 We look forward to receiving your application by June 15th. We process applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait too long to submit yours.
   

  

*Fazer, The Food Experience Company, enables people to enjoy the best moments of their day. Our mission, Food with a purpose, builds on our strong more than 130-year heritage, consumer first approach and innovations to create the sustainable food solutions of the future. With our dedicated team of approximately 5,000 professionals, we focus on fast-moving consumer goods and our direct-to-consumer business in Northern Europe, and beyond with exports to more than 40 countries. Fazer’s operations comply with its Code of Conduct that is based on the Group’s values and the UN Global Compact. In 2024, Fazer Group had net sales of 1,200 million euros.*
***Northern Magic.***
***Made Real.***

title: VMware Administrator
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Banking
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Senior Operations Engineer (Windows & VMware)
 



**Location:** 
 On-site - Solna and/or Forsmark, Sweden
 



**Reports to:** 
 Head of IT Operations
 



  





**Position Overview** 




 We are seeking a highly security-conscious Senior Operations Engineer to manage the daily operations of our private cloud platform. This senior, hands-on role requires an expert in Windows Server and VMware technologies to administrate and defend critical infrastructure in a secure, on-site environment, with a primary focus on maintaining exceptional security, stability, and legal compliance.
 



**Key Responsibilities** 



* **Platform Management:** 
 Perform daily administration, monitoring, and optimization of our private cloud environment built on VMware (ESX, NSX, vSAN) and Windows Server.
* **Security & Compliance:** 
 Implement and enforce stringent security policies and system hardening. Ensure all systems and operations are fully compliant with legal and regulatory standards and support regular security audits.
* **Incident & Lifecycle Management:** 
 Provide senior-level troubleshooting and root cause analysis. Manage the infrastructure's full lifecycle, including patching, upgrades, and vulnerability remediation.
* **Documentation:** 
 Maintain comprehensive technical documentation for system configurations and operational protocols.



**Essential Skills & Qualifications** 




 Candidates must meet the following criteria:
 


* **Mandatory Residency Requirement:** 
 Applicants
 **must** 
 have resided continuously in a European country for
 **more than five (5) consecutive years** 
 without breaks. This is a non-negotiable requirement for security clearance.
* **Senior-Level Experience:** 
 Proven track record as a Senior Systems or Infrastructure Engineer in an enterprise environment.
* **Expertise in VMware:** 
 Deep, hands-on experience managing and securing large-scale environments with vSphere/ESX, NSX, and vSAN.
* **Expertise in Windows Security:** 
 Advanced knowledge of Windows Server administration and proven experience securing Windows environments (Active Directory, Group Policy, system hardening).
* **Security Mindset:** 
 A profound understanding of IT security principles is essential, as security and legal compliance are the cornerstones of this role.



**Desired Skills** 



* Experience with automation and scripting (PowerShell, PowerCLI).
* Relevant industry certifications (VCP-DCV, VCP-NV, MCSE).
* Familiarity with ITIL frameworks.
* Experience working in regulated or high-security industries.

title: Key Account Manager
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience—fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Are you ready to take the lead in shaping the future of food delivery partnerships? At foodora, we’re looking for a driven and strategic Key Account Manager to build and grow relationships with our most influential restaurant partners. This is your chance to work at the heart of a fast-paced, data-driven environment where your decisions directly impact our business. Join us in transforming the food scene - one partnership at a time.**
**Your mission**
* Own and manage relationships with foodora’s largest restaurant chains, ensuring long-term growth and profitability.
* Lead complex and high-stakes negotiations, from preparation to successful closure, always acting in the best interest of both foodora and the partner.
* Develop and maintain strong, trust-based relationships with decision-makers at senior levels within partner organizations.
* Proactively identify and execute on new business opportunities and areas for growth within existing accounts.
* Co-create long-term, profitable campaigns with your partners to drive order volume and customer engagement.
* Monitor and analyze customer performance, taking data-driven action to optimize results.
* Participate in strategic planning, contributing insights and feedback from the field to help shape foodora’s broader commercial strategy.
* Act as the internal advocate for your key accounts, collaborating cross-functionally with Marketing, Vendor Operations, and Product teams to ensure seamless execution and partner satisfaction.


 We are looking for a true foodorian who enjoys working in a fast paced environment and dares to go further. To thrive in this role we believe that you are
 **result oriented** 
 and keep your eyes on the prize, we love to measure both success and find opportunities for improvement, which we hope that you also do! If you have strong
 **analytical skills** 
 and a
 **can do-attitude** 
 you will come far in this role! Since you will be in contact with our biggest restaurant partners, your skills as a
 **relationship builde** 
 r will be crucial to achieve your results.
   

  

 Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
   

  

 Our recruitment process will include the following:
   

  

 📞 Telephone interview - Let’s cover the basics!
   

  

 💡 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.
   

  

 🤝 First interview - Time to know each other a bit better!
   

  

 💼 Case interview - Do your magic and show us your skills!
   

  

 ✔️ Reference- & background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues.
   

  

 Start date: Upon agreement
   

  

**Qualifications**
* A minimum of 5 years experience within Sales, Key Account Management or Business Development.
* You communicate fluently verbally and in writing in both Swedish and English.
* Previous experience from tech or FMCG companies is considered a big plus.
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets.
* If you have a driver's license it’s considered a plus.


**Additional Information**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora such as free group training at Sats & reduced price on massage.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and inspiring courses within our learning tool Sana
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: Working Student: Financial Assistant
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media and Holding Companies
description:
**About the role** 




  





 MTG is a fast-growing international mobile gaming group with a diversified portfolio of popular games and franchises that attract players across the world. Our vision is to build the gaming village of the future, where game makers and entrepreneurs can come together to accelerate their growth and evolution while preserving their creativity, identity, and culture. We combine strong organic growth with long-term thinking and an approach that puts people first. MTG is also one of the driving forces behind the ongoing consolidation of the gaming industry and will continue to be so, thanks to our strong balance sheet.
 



  





 MTG is now looking to enhance our small accounting team with a part-time
 **Financial Assistant,** 
 a student who is looking for additional work experience while completing studies. You will be based in our HQ in central Stockholm (1x/week) and report to the Head of Financial Reporting. The role can flex around your study schedule, but we’re thinking
 **approximately 10 hours per week,** 
 paid hourly, with more hours around closing and reporting periods.
 



  





 We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Working Student to support our small accounting team. In this role, you will gain hands-on experience in core finance operations and contribute to the smooth running of our day-to-day accounting processes. This is a great opportunity to deepen your understanding of bookkeeping and financial systems in a dynamic and international business environment.
 



  





 We love globally minded people who have a great sense of humour, like to get their hands dirty, are team players and have a challenger mindset. If that’s you, let’s talk!
 



  





**What you’ll do:** 




  




* Assist in bookkeeping and account reconciliations
* Help manage expense tracking and processing
* Build and maintain financial reports using NetSuite
* Help streamline our financial processes and workflows
* Take the lead on process optimization and digitalization initiatives
* Support month-end and quarterly reporting (expect busier periods)
* Work closely with our experienced finance team to learn the ropes



  





**What We Offer** 




  




* Flexible hours designed around your academic schedule
* Hands-on experience with real financial operations
* Mentorship from experienced finance professionals
* Exposure to the gaming industry and international business
* Competitive hourly rate
* Future potential career opportunities



  





**The skills and experience we’re looking for:** 




  




* Current student based in Stockholm
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
* Interest in finance, accounting, or business operations
* Comfortable learning new software
* Able to work independently while being part of a collaborative team
* Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to work effectively with stakeholders around the world, adapting to different cultures and communication styles.
* Able to read and understand Swedish at a proficient level (C1), as most documentation is in Swedish
* A sense of humour combined with a mindset that focuses on finding solutions rather than seeing problems.



  





**How to apply** 




  





 Please send your CV via LinkedIn with a short intro note, or mail to
 **jobs@mtg.com** 
 to apply.
 



  





*Please don’t send a traditional cover letter and keep it succinct. We’d especially like to know about your global business experience and how you’ve worked with international teams in the past. We’d also like to hear why you think MTG is the right place for you. We assume your CV will show your technical suitability for the role. We look forward to hearing from you!*

title: Security Engineer
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the team** 




 As part of fulfilling the objective of becoming the leading global online banking payments provider, we are strengthening our capability in the information and cyber security area. Currently, we are restructuring our internal setup within the security area allowing us to scale and grow our teams.
 



  





 To get us going we are now looking for additional Security Engineers to join the Security and Compliance team focusing on our product security in Europe.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As a Security Engineer at Trustly, you will be part of a team of security professionals ensuring security lies in the core of everything we build and operate. We combine our expertise in providing security services to the organization with automating security controls wherever and whenever possible.
 



  





 As our team is undergoing an expansive phase, you will have the opportunity to shape our direction and methodologies. Your contributions will be important in refining our interactions with merchants, allowing you to leave a large impact on our operational security framework.
 




  




**What you’ll do** 
* Ensure our vulnerability management program maintains coverage of all applicable assets, by building automation that makes sure our tools are up to date and supports our teams to keep our software secure
* Perform security assessments and provide security guidance of the product we build through design reviews, code reviews as well as performing dynamic testing, working closely with the development teams
* Research and implement security controls on top of the CI/CD pipeline
* Design and execute internal penetration testing activities
* Compromise our hosts and data with exploitation of vulnerabilities to assess actual risks involved and understand what controls that failed to protect
* Proactively gather threat intelligence and build tools that enable us to identify and act on external threats efficiently and intelligently



  




**Who you are** 
* You have spent a few years in the area of cyber security doing hands-on technical security work
* Detailed technical knowledge of techniques, standards and state-of-the art capabilities for authentication and authorisation, applied cryptography, security vulnerabilities and remediation
* DNS, TLS, X.509, CVEs and SOAR/SIEM systems are no strangers to you
* Experience from hands-on technical security assessments such as penetration tests, web application tests, code reviews etc
* Passionate about working with application developers in "shifting left", introducing security controls early on in the development process
* Any security certification (e.g. OSCP, OSWE or similar)
* Bachelor/Masters/PhD degree in Computer Science or Cybersecurity is considered a plus






  




  


**Our Fantastic Benefits**




 🌴
 **20 to 30 days of holiday** 
 (depending on location) to support a healthy work-life balance
 



 🥳
 **Monthly team outing allowance** 
 to enjoy social events with your colleagues
 



 👶
 **Parental leave top-up** 
 additional support for new parents
 



 🥐
 **Daily breakfast and on-site perks** 
 to make your workday smoother
 



 💚
 **Well being support** 
 our health allowance covers gym memberships, massages, and much more to help you feel your best
 



**PLUS** 
 additional benefits designed to enhance your work-life experience!
 



  





**Shape Your Role and Make an Impact**




 Join a dynamic environment where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously embrace new challenges. We’re looking for dedicated and highly motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy collaborating across different areas of the organisation.
 



 If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you!
 **Apply now and submit your CV in English.**

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
We are a leading technology company that specializes in providing innovative solutions to our clients across various industries. Our company is expanding its operations in Sweden and is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Infrastructure Engineer with Hands & Feet Support to join our team.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




 • Manage and maintain the physical infrastructure sites in Stockholm and Linkoping, Sweden.
 



 • Perform hands-on support for all IT equipment, including servers, network devices, and other hardware.
 



 • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to the infrastructure.
 



 • Install, configure, and maintain servers, switches, routers, and other network equipment.
 



 • Monitor and ensure the availability and performance of the network and servers.
 



 • Conduct regular maintenance and upgrades to the infrastructure.
 



 • Collaborate with the IT team to design and implement new infrastructure solutions.
 



 • Keep up-to-date documentation of the infrastructure and network configurations.
 



 • Ensure compliance with security policies and procedures.
 



 • Provide hands-on support for any IT-related projects and initiatives.
 



  





**Qualifications:** 




 • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
 



 • Minimum of 4 years of experience in a similar role.
 



 • Strong knowledge of network and server infrastructure.
 



 • Hands on experience with switches and routers.
 



 • Experience with technologies such as VMware or Hyper-V, vRops, Linux,Backup, storage, networking.
 



 and Windows administration.
 



 • Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
 



 • Ability to work independently and collaborate with remote team & client in India & USA.
 



 • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
 



 • Willingness to travel to different sites as needed.
