title: Junior Data Engineer
company_industry: Embedded Software Products, Think Tanks, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Ready to take your first steps into the world of data engineering, and want to do it somewhere you can learn, grow and make a real impact?**
 At Redeploy, we design, build, scale and maintain modern solutions across Cloud, Data and AI, helping ambitious companies across the Nordics transform how they work with technology. As a trusted partner to Microsoft, AWS and Databricks, we deliver platforms that are built for impact and built to last.
   

  

 What sets us apart is the way we work. Curiosity runs deep here, as does the drive to keep learning and sharing. You’ll join a team that values ownership, collaboration and high technical standards, and where people genuinely care about doing things well. For our clients. And for each other.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a JuniorData Engineer at Redeploy, you’ll be joining a team of cloud and data specialists working on large-scale projects for clients across the Nordics. From day one, you’ll be learning by doing - getting hands-on experience in real projects alongside more senior colleagues, while taking part in onboarding, certifications and team knowledge sharing. You’ll work in tech-focused delivery teams and support in building modern data platforms using tools like Databricks, Azure or AWS. Depending on the client, the project might involve optimizing an existing solution or building something entirely new from the ground up. Over time, you’ll learn how to design and implement data pipelines, structure and model data, understand data architecture and contribute to scalable, future-ready solutions.
   

  

**What You’ll Grow Into**
 This role is a great starting point for anyone looking to kick off their career in data engineering. You’ll be supported every step of the way – through mentoring, certifications, team collaboration and real-life experience. As you grow, you’ll have the chance to specialize further in cloud and data engineering, or broaden your skills towards architecture, Infrastructure, analytics or AI. Our flat structure and strong learning culture means there’s always room to explore new areas, take on more responsibility and find your own path forward – whether you want to become a technical expert, a lead or someone who bridges tech and business.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
 We’re looking for someone who’s early in their career but ready to dive into complex technical challenges and grow fast. You’re curious, collaborative and have a genuine interest in data engineering – how it works, how it scales, and how it creates value. Since you’ll be working closely with clients and colleagues, we also value the soft skills: being communicative, open to feedback, and comfortable asking questions. You don’t need to have all the answers yet – what matters is that you’re motivated to learn, contribute, and take ownership of your development.
   

  

**What Experiences You Bring**
* A University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems or a related technical field
* Fundamental knowledge in Python and SQL
* Understanding of object-oriented programming and database methodology
* An interest in data platforms and cloud technologies (Azure, AWS or GCP)
* Familiarity with Git and version control
* Experience with Spark is a plus
* You may have done a thesis, internship, or side project involving data, and are now looking for your first full-time role
* Fluency in Swedish and English is required


**Curious to learn more before applying?**
 Have a look around our career site to explore our culture, people and way of working. And if you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our Talent Acquisition Manager, Francisca Andersson.
   

  

*We’re aiming to hire 2–3 junior Data Engineers starting in the autumn, and we’re reviewing applications continuously – we’d love to hear from you soon.*

title: Client Executive to Mid Corporate Real Estate, SEB | Stockholm
description:
We are excited to announce an opportunity within our Mid Corporate team in Stockholm as a Client Executive for Real Estate customers. The portfolio of customers you will manage includes both real estate developers and property managers.
   

  

**About SEB Mid Corporate**
 Mid Corporate is a prioritized business area for SEB and we have the strongest brand in the Swedish mid-market. Mid Corporate Sweden oversees SEB’s risk, profitability, and relationships for a portfolio of mid-sized customers across the Corporate, Financial Sponsor, Public and Real Estate segments.
   

  

 Currently we are ranked second in the Prospera customer satisfaction survey, and our goal is to lead the industry in customer satisfaction over time. We are committed to growing both with existing clients and by onboarding new, targeted companies.
   

  

 One of our focus areas is the Real Estate segment, where industry-specific expertise is essential to build strong client relationships, provide proactive advisory, and offer SEB’s full range of products and services.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Client Executive to join our team in Stockholm and help us drive growth in the Real Estate segment.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Client Executive, you will lead your client team, driving forward both your portfolio of existing real estate customers and identifying new business prospects.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities Will Include**
* Lead the client team in day-to-day operations, ensuring alignment with Mid Corporate Sweden’s strategy and values.
* Take national responsibility for a defined group of real estate companies, serving as the primary point of contact for SEB’s offerings and proactively managing relationships with existing clients and driving prospecting of new clients.
* Identify new business opportunities through strategic dialogue and collaboration with SEB’s product teams e.g. Debt Capital Market, Markets, Private Wealth Management, Corporate Finance.
* Oversee credit risk management and drive business development in close cooperation with the customer and your client team.


 You will report to the Co-Head of Mid Corporate Stockholm. This role is based in Stockholm.
   

  

 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

* A higher academic degree in economics or a related field, along with a Swed Sec license.
* A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in sales, relationship management, and credit, preferably within banking or relevant real estate environment.
* A strong analytical skill from both a business- and credit perspective.
* A solid understanding of banking products and services.
* Knowledge of the real estate industry and an understanding of the role of properties in community development.
* Great interest in sustainability and digitalization with the eagerness to expand your expertise in the area.
* Strong communication and presentation skills, coupled with a strong reputation in your professional environment.
* A commercially driven person with the ability to lead, motivate, and coach team members.


 As a Client Executive, and an informal leader for your client team, you are expected to create the best conditions to deliver on Mid Corporate Sweden’s business plan, KPIs, and strategic initiatives to drive your customers forward.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 We offer a highly sought-after role with great opportunities to influence and drive the future growth of the Real Estate segment within Mid Corporate Sweden. As a Client Executive, you will inspire and motivate your client team, setting a powerful example of excellence in customer engagement and leadership. The role is customer-focused, emphasizing the importance of building strong relationships with both existing and new customers. Your ability to network within SEB will be crucial, as Mid Corporate offers all SEB products and services to our customers.
   

  

 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application, including your CV and personal letter, as soon as possible, but no later than June 8th 2025. If you have any questions about the position, please contact Olga Wohlfahrt, Talent Acquisition Partner, at olga.wohlfahrt@seb.se .
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Senior IT-Operations Specialist
description:
****Hello, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?****
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


 As IT-Operations Lead, you will play a pivotal role in transforming and elevating our internal IT landscape. You will drive the centralization and standardization of IT processes, streamline operations, and ensure that our technology environment not only supports but actively enhances the productivity and security of our global teams. This is a unique opportunity to shape how IT is delivered at a growing, international tech company, working hands-on with Google Workspace, Atlassian, AI, other modern SaaS tools, and automation. You will collaborate closely with business stakeholders, lead process improvement initiatives, and the security team. Your expertise will be instrumental in building a scalable, secure, and future-proof IT foundation that supports Truecaller’s continued growth and innovation.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* End-User Support – provide IT support for employees using Windows, macOS, and Linux systems on both PCs and Macs.
* New Employee Onboarding – set up and configure laptops, user accounts, and system access for new hires, ensuring a smooth onboarding experience.
* Lead the design, documentation, and implementation of IT processes and best practices to centralize and streamline internal IT operations.
* Own the administration, optimization, and continuous improvement of Google Workspace, Atlassian stack (Jira, Confluence), and other core SaaS platforms.
* Collaborate with business units to identify needs, gather feedback, and deliver IT solutions that drive organizational efficiency and user satisfaction.
* Ensure compliance with security, privacy, and regulatory requirements across all IT operations.
* Mentor and support IT staff, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and professional development.
* Manage IT projects, including timelines, resources, budgets, and stakeholder communication.
* Oversee vendor relationships, contracts, and service level agreements.
* Develop and maintain documentation for IT policies, procedures, and systems.
* Proactively evaluate and introduce new technologies and tools to enhance the IT environment and support business goals.


**What You Bring In**
* 5+ years of experience in IT administration, operations, or similar senior technical roles.
* Deep expertise in Google Workspace and Atlassian stack (Jira, Confluence) administration and optimization.
* Strong knowledge of SaaS/cloud-based IT infrastructure and modern workplace technologies (e.g., SSO, MDM, endpoint management).
* Proven experience designing and implementing IT processes, policies, and documentation.
* Solid understanding of IT security, compliance, and data privacy principles.
* Experience managing IT projects, including planning, execution, and stakeholder communication.
* Advanced troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
* Strong communication skills, able to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field (or equivalent experience).


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Experience with automation, scripting (e.g., PowerShell, Python), and process automation tools.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and cloud security best practices.
* Exposure to DevOps methodologies, CI/CD pipelines, and container technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Knowledge of ITIL, Agile, or other IT service management frameworks.
* Experience with endpoint management, MDM solutions, and identity/access management.
* Previous experience in a fast-growing tech or SaaS company.


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you**

title: Konsultchef ACC Stockholm
description:
*ACC är Norra Europas ledande glas och fasadkonsulter. När vi går till jobbet är det för att skapa välpresterande klimatskal för framtidens hållbara, och många gånger, häpnadsväckande byggnader. Men ingen kan göra det ensam. Så hos oss finns kompetenser inom konstruktion, design, dimensionering, dagsljus, inomhusklimat, hållbarhet, ekonomi och besiktning.*
*Allt fler upptäcker nyttan och behovet av rätt projekterade glas- och fasadkonstruktioner, vilket betyder att vi har mycket att göra. På ACC finns ett trettiotal prestigelösa och drivna kollegor fördelade i Stockholm, Göteborg, Kalmar och Sydsverige. Känn dig varmt välkommen med din ansökan!*
**Beskrivning av rollen som Konsultchef på ACC i Stockholm**
 Rollen som Konsultchef är en delad roll dvs du kommer arbeta som Glas och Fasadkonsult inom ditt område parallellt med din uppdrag som Konsultchef. Konsultchefen är en engagerad ledare som skapar förutsättningar för andra att utvecklas, nå sina individuella mål och kunna leverera på sina arbetsuppgifter.
   

  

 Rollen som Konsultchef innefattar:
   

  

* Övergripande ansvar för medarbetarna som tillhör Stockholmskontoret
* Bidra till att skapa en positiv och produktiv arbetsmiljö, planera och genomföra möten och aktiviteter för kontoret
* Bidra till och stödja medarbetare i deras professionella utveckling, planera och genomföra mål- och utvecklingssamtal tillsammans med affärsområdescheferna
* Hantera personalfrågor och arbetsmiljöfrågor vid kontoret och ACC
* Följa upp och utvärdera medarbetares trivsel och prestationer i projekt i samråd med affärsområdescheferna, förebygga stress och stötta med resursplanering
* Samordna mellan kontoren med konsultchefen för Göteborg
* Ansvar för lönesättning och lönediskussioner (partners löner hanteras av VD)
* Bistå med affärsutveckling och säljinsatser, deltagande på kundmöten och bygga kundrelationer.


 Teamet som du kommer att ansvara för i Stockholm består idag av ca 17 medarbetare, vissa jobbar stor del av tiden ute på platsbesök medan andra är mer närvarande på kontoret. Rollen kan komma att till viss del förändras beroende på sökandes bakgrund och erfarenhet.
   

  

**Det här kan du förvänta dig**
* En roll där du får ansvar för att leda och bidra till dina kollegors utveckling
* Att vara en ledare i ett växande företag i absolut framkant inom sitt teknikområde
* Avsatt tid för att kunna utföra dina konsultchefsuppgifter
* En roll inom företaget där din kunskap är efterfrågad och högt värdesatt
* Arbete i nära samarbete med både affärsområdeschefer och ledningsgruppen
* Möjlighet att utvecklas i din yrkesroll och nå dina professionella mål
* Marknadsmässig lön, förmåner och bra arbetsvillkor


**Viktiga egenskaper för att lyckas i rollen**
 Du vill bidra till att ACC blir en ännu bättre arbetsgivare. Du gillar att ta ansvar och har förmågan att jobba självständigt och i nära samarbete med andra chefer, kollegor och kunder. Du ser dig själv i en ledande och rådgivande roll med förmåga att leda och organisera ditt eget och andras arbete.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära dina chefskollegor som är affärsområdeschefer och med konsulter
   

  

 på ACC som är projektledare, projektörer och specialister som alla bidrar med sin kompetens för att hitta den bästa lösningen för våra kunder och deras projekt.
   

  

**Önskad profil**
* Erfarenhet med personalansvar och ledarskap
* Goda ledaregenskaper
* Flerårig erfarenhet från arbete inom glas och fasad eller besläktat teknikområde
* God förmåga att kommunicera och samarbeta med olika intressenter
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Förmåga att skapa motivation och engagemang
* Det är meriterande om du har tidigare erfarenhet av ekonomi- och budgetarbete eller som gruppledare eller chef inom ett konsultföretag i byggbranschen.


 I rollen som Konsultchef kommer du får stöd från HR-resurs samt dina chefskollegor. Du kommer även erbjudas ledarskapsutbildning och coaching. ACC har investerat i och implementerar ett HR system i vilket du kommer få bra stöd i ditt arbete som ledare.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Skriv några rader kring varför du är intresserad av tjänsten som Konsultchef och varför du är en bra kandidat för rollen. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Startdatum**
 Enligt senare överenskommelse

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
**Technical Project Manager!** 




  





 ITRS (iGaming) are currently partnered with a Stockholm-based iGaming studio who are looking for a Technical Project Manager.
 



  





 They are looking for a Technical Project Manager to handle ongoing live maintenance for their games, manage release cycles, handle new feature implementation projects for live game titles, and prioritize the day-to-day maintenance work. .
 



  





 The company hold regular team building events, so someone who loves social events and a positive work environment is essential!
 



  





**Job Description** 




  




* Oversee task allocation and coordinate closely with the development team to manage and resolve reported issues.
* Manage the update and release process for new game versions, including reviewing QA testing results and providing actionable feedback.
* Track the progress of ongoing feature development and ensure smooth transitions from development through to production deployment.
* Deliver regular, detailed updates to both the product and operations teams to maintain alignment and visibility across departments.



  





**Essential Skills & Experience** 




  




* At least 1 year of technical education or equivalent hands-on experience.
* Minimum of 1 year in a project management role within a technical environment, ideally in game development or a SaaS-focused organization. Experience should cover the full release lifecycle—from initial planning through to deployment.
* Proficient with project management and issue tracking tools such as Jira, Trello, or equivalent platforms.
* Solid understanding of software testing processes, methodologies, and best practices.
* Exceptionally organized and proactive, with a strong ability to stay on top of multiple projects and game update cycles. Regular reporting on status and progress will be an expected part of the role.



  





**Bonus Skills/Experience** 




  




* Previous iGaming industry experience.



  





**The Offer** 




  




* A salary band of roughly SEK 40k to SEK 65k pm (depending on experience)
* A centrally located office in Stockholm
* Working as part of a high-quality team of industry experts.
* Health benefit package
* 25 paid days vacation
* Regular team building events.

title: Cloud & AI Infrastructure Sales Executive
description:
**Job Description**
 Oracle is at the forefront of the digital transformation, empowering businesses with cutting-edge AI and Cloud Infrastructure solutions, encompassing both Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS). We’re looking for a Cloud & AI
   

  

 Infrastructure Sales Executive to drive force behind advancing customer missions through the power of Oracle's comprehensive cloud portfolio. We have phenomenal career opportunities for every experience level and celebrate a culture of support and learning.
   

  

 Create the future with us!
   

  

 What you will do
   

  

 Engage in strategic C-level conversations to uncover cloud transformation opportunities while conducting indepth needs assessments and solution demonstrations. You will collaborate with technical experts to craft tailored cloud proposals and negotiate complex
   

  

 contracts and ensure seamless deal execution by:
   

  

* Evangelizing Oracle's Cloud Vision: Become a trusted advisor to C-level executives, demonstrating how Oracle's AI and Cloud Infrastructure solutions can transform their businesses and drive unprecedented success.
* Leading Transformational Deals: Orchestrate complex sales cycles, navigating technical intricacies and securing buy-in from multiple stakeholders.
* Scaling Cloud Adoption Across Industries: Identify high-potential opportunities across diverse sectors, tailoring Oracle's cloud solutions to address unique challenges.
* Forging Strategic Partnerships: Collaborate with Oracle's partner ecosystem to expand market reach and deliver comprehensive cloud solutions.
* Being a Champion for Customer Success: Ensure seamless implementation and adoption of Oracle's cloud technology, fostering long-term customer relationships.


 Your Experience
   

  

* Proven Sales Acumen: several years of enterprise software/cloud sales experience, with a track record of


 exceeding targets and closing multimillion- dollar deals.
   

  

* C-Level Engagement: Demonstrated ability to build relationships and influence senior executives across various industries.
* Cloud Passion and Expertise: Deep understanding of cloud technologies (IaaS, PaaS, AI) and their potential applications across different business functions.
* Technical Fluency: Ability to articulate complex technical concepts in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Customer-Centric Approach: Unwavering commitment to understanding customer needs and delivering exceptional value.


**Responsibilities**
 Oracle's Cloud Advantage
   

  

* Industry Leadership: Oracle's cloud solutions are recognized for their innovation, security, and scalability.
* Unmatched Data Security: Oracle's unique approach to data security ensures customer data remains protected throughout the cloud journey.
* Customer-Centric Focus: Oracle is committed to partnering with customers to achieve their cloud goals and drive long-term


 success.
   

  

* Culture of Innovation: Oracle fosters a collaborative environment where employees are encouraged to push boundaries and


 unleash their full potential.
   

  

* Comprehensive Portfolio: Oracle offers a complete suite of cloud solutions, including IaaS, PaaS, and AI, providing customers with


 a one-stop shop for their digital transformation needs.
   

  

 What we will offer you
   

  

* A competitive salary with exciting benefits
* Flexible working so you can do your best work
* Learning and development opportunities to advance your career
* An Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health
* Employee resource groups that champion our diverse communities
* Core benefits such as medical, life insurance, and access to retirement planning
* An inclusive culture that celebrates what makes you unique


**Qualifications**
 Career Level - IC4
   

  

**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s challenges. We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 We know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. That’s why we’re committed to growing an inclusive workforce that promotes opportunities for all.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer competitive benefits based on parity and consistency and support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by emailing accommodation-request\_mb@oracle.com or by calling +1 888 404 2494 in the United States.
   

  

 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

title: Executive Assistant, Amazon Web Services, Northern Europe
description:
**Description**
 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a proactive, customer obsessed and team oriented Executive Assistant to support the Managing Director and the Technical Director of AWS Europe North. This role requires attention to detail, organizational skills, and the ability to meet tight deadlines. The candidate will be comfortable in a fast-paced, fluid environment, while maintaining great flexibility, a sense of humor and composure. The candidate will work autonomously on many projects as required and possess the ability to complete a high volume of tasks with minimal guidance or supervision.
   

  

 Amazon EAs are the primary point of contact and information flow to and from a variety of teams, clients and partners to our senior leaders - we seek to hire and then offer continual development to the very best EAs ready to work in our fast paced, customer focused organization.
   

  

 We are looking for bright and motivated candidates with experience of supporting multiple executives and who can demonstrate expertise with complex diary management, travel arrangements and expense recording as well as the set-up, budgeting and active management of small to mid-scale events for their teams.
   

  

 Superior attention to detail and the ability to meet tight deadlines and juggle multiple requests is critical. Integrity and discretion in handling confidential information and professionalism in dealing with senior executives is imperative. A flexible approach is a must, and the ability to change direction at a moment’s notice.
   

  

 As a community, the EAs work together to deliver large scale events and to share workload when priorities demand additional support - commitment to teamwork is essential.
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience with reconciling expenses
* Substantial experience assisting at the executive level in a fast-paced environment
* Highly proficient with Microsoft Office, specifically Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
* Experience coordinating and communicating using tools like Slack
* Experience with domestic and international travel coordination


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Senior experience assisting at the executive level
* Ability to quickly learn organizational structures, team objectives and adopt Amazon values and vision
* Ability to handle administrative details independently while exercising good judgment in keeping team members adequately informed
* Creative approach to problem solving and event planning
* Ability to handle confidential information with discretion, and deal with professionals inside and outside the company
* Ability to work in a highly ambiguous and changing environment with composure


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2983213

title: Manager - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 As a Manager at BCG Platinion in the Nordics, you are responsible for the execution and management of our national and international client projects. We collaborate with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on site and directly with the client company. The Manager role incorporates structuring the project and performing the required resource planning. Besides the functional navigation of the project members, you will also be involved operationally in the project business. Together with our clients, you will develop convincing IT strategies, concepts and solutions, applying technical know-how and extensive experience in structuring IT projects, just as analytical and conceptual skills. We independently support our clients, present our results to their decision makers, and agree on the next steps.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
* bring a completed a degree in computer science, (business) informatics, or a related area with above-average grades
* have at least eight years of substantial experience in IT consulting and the lead design and management of IT strategy and implementation projects
* already captured project-related management experience as the lead of teams with more than five people
* know how to plan IT initiatives and build solid business cases
* optimally steer decisions towards the goal and master escalating situations with an eye to solutions - even in complex organizational structures
* have successfully acquired consulting projects
* are excellent at understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
* Independently contribute to build close client relationships - and as their trusted advisor, you are the first to whom they turn
* Acquire new projects and challenges for our company and yourself
* Be in charge of planning, leading, and assuring quality for strategic IT projects - we work with passion for our clients' long-term success
* Get to use your comprehensive knowledge of technology and industry understanding to provide both internal and external stakeholders with the orientation they need in critical project phases and challenging situations
* Think across projects and connecting factors, and plan resources to achieve the best efficiency possible
* Take ownership for presenting key project results at the highest level of client management
* Work with an entrepreneurial approach and passion to advance BCG Platinion with your contributions to people development, recruiting, and practice areas


 Additional info
   

  

**How To Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Solution Architect - Integration
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues both locally and around the world, reimagining what’s possible. For this role you will be part of the Cloud and Custom Application (C&CA) area at Capgemini, you will work with the latest technologies in Cloud, Integration, AI, and software development. We develop tailored applications and manage complex integrations to maximize the potential of technology. Join us and collaborate with the world's leading organizations to realize the full value of technology through innovative solutions.
   

  

**Your role**
 As an Integration Architect with Capgemini, you will be involved in leading the development and implementation of integration solutions, leveraging your expertise to drive platform transitions and support various transformation initiatives.
   

  

 In this role, you will play a key role in:
   

  

* Managing integrations and preferably transitioning to Azure Integration.
* Addressing general platform anxiety and facilitating moves between tech platforms.
* Conducting assessments and developing strategies to future-proof integration methods and establish Centers for Enablement.
* Supporting other transformations such as ERP to accelerate delivery.


**Your profile**
 Integration architect with at least 5 years of experience. Used to act forward leaning, and confident driver of change and/or excellence. Solution-oriented with a platform mindset. We prefer you to have a full professional proficiency in English and Swedish.
   

  

 Expert in some of these areas, and preferable handle several:
   

  

* Azure Integration
* iPaaS (MuleSoft, Boomi, Apigee)
* Open source integration
* Middleware (BizTalk, Tibco/IBM/etc)
* Nice to have, other hyperscale’s integration services e.g. AWS & GCP and of course an interest in generative AI


**Application**
 Excited to embark on a new career journey? We can't wait to hear from you! Apply now – we review applications continuously. Throughout the process, you'll have the opportunity to visit our office, meet with our hiring manager, and ask any questions you may have to our recruiter. We are committed to making your path to the job as seamless and fulfilling as possible. Are you the candidate we're searching for? We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.*
**What We Belive You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies
* Our Values: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
****Why This Role Matters****
 Internal Data & Analytics (IDA) is a centralised data function within the Product Development organisation. Our purpose is to facilitate a move to a decentralised data architecture that will put trustworthy, high-quality, and actionable data in the hands of every Funnel employee. We are expected to have a solid understanding of how our business operates, a strong sense of what our organisation needs, and a proactive mindset.
   

  

 Our role spans both building software and serving analytics needs. While this role is officially titled "Analytics Engineer," it encompasses responsibilities that go beyond traditional analytics engineering. Depending on priorities, your focus may shift between data engineering, analytics engineering, and descriptive analytics.
   

  

 We are a relatively new and small team with a lot of room for creativity within our problem space. As part of IDA, you can make a noticeable impact by helping more colleagues leverage analytics in their daily work and driving the data maturity of our organisation forward. Along the way, there will be plenty of opportunities to learn and grow in the fields we operate in—a pursuit we expect and encourage at Funnel.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a team member of IDA, you will operate at the intersection of Data Engineering, Analytics Engineering, and Data Platform Engineering. Your key responsibilities include:
   

  

**Data Engineering**
* Design, develop, and maintain ETL/ELT pipelines to process and integrate data from other teams and systems into our team infrastructure.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define, document, and implement data governance policies, ensuring compliance and quality.


**Data Product Delivery**
* Model the output of our pipelines into quality data assets that are ready for self-serve analytics.
* Act as a technical advisor to teams looking to implement their own data solutions in a federated data ownership model.


**Descriptive Analytics**
* Serve insights and best practices in order to drive adoption of data products and features.


**Platform Development**
* Research and implement modern data engineering best practices (e.g., CI/CD processes, infrastructure as code, quality assurance).
* Maintain and improve our architecture to ensure it is best in class and built to last.
* Develop an efficient infrastructure on AWS that complies with our data security policies and certifications.


**Team Collaboration**
* Be a willing collaborator, identify opportunities to support others, and offer timely help.
* Seek and provide feedback through code reviews, retrospectives, and strategic discussions.
* Learn by doing, share knowledge with others, and try out new things that could grow the team's skillset.
* Promote the team's achievements, engage with our stakeholders, and drive adoption of our products.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Strong SQL skills and experience building and maintaining data pipelines (ETL/ELT) in a cloud-based environment (e.g., GCP, AWS).
* Proficiency in Python for data processing, automation, or API integrations.
* Hands-on experience with modern data stack tools (e.g., dbt, Airflow, or similar).
* Knowledge of data modelling techniques, particularly for analytics and business intelligence.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work across technical and non-technical teams.
* A problem-solving mindset with a passion for delivering actionable insights.
* Fluency in English


**Nice to Have**
* Experience with SaaS metrics, product analytics, or revenue data.
* Familiarity with Data Mesh principles and federated data ownership.
* Understanding of data governance, privacy, and compliance frameworks.
* Knowledge of CI/CD workflows and infrastructure as code for data pipelines.
* Exposure to BI tools like Tableau, Looker, or Power BI.


****What We Offer****
* A position where you can shape the future of data and analytics within our organisation.
* A high level of autonomy and responsibility for those who take initiative.
* A collaborative team environment where your opinion matters.
* A fast-paced environment with lots of opportunities for practical learning.


**What Makes You a Great Match For Funnel**
 This role is designed for individuals who thrive in dynamic, collaborative environments and are excited about building the foundations of a world-class data organisation. Whether your expertise leans toward Data Engineering, Analytics Engineering, or Data Platform Engineering, we believe the breadth of this role will provide ample opportunity to learn, grow, and make an impact.
   

  

 Learn more about how we are developing our product in this blog post by our CTO, Jonas Björk: Building Funnel’s Data Platform for Marketing Analytics.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

 At this time, we can only consider applicants who are already located in
 **Stockholm.**
**Benefits & Perks**
 We offer a competitive salary along with great benefits. → Take a look at our benefits here.
   

  

**Office-first**
 At Funnel, we have an office-first approach, and we work from the office a minimum of four days a week. We have lots of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer, through the holidays however, we avoid having standing remote days.
   

  

**Interview Process**
 We have a 4-step recruitment process for most roles → Get an overview of the steps here.
   

  

**Inclusiveness**
 Research shows that many candidates, especially women and individuals from underrepresented groups, may hesitate to apply for a role unless they meet every requirement. If this role excites you and your skills and experiences align, we strongly encourage you to apply. We’re interested in what you can bring, even if you don’t check every box.
   

  

**About Funnel**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting.
   

  

 Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi-Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Funnel enables a workflow that automates the collection of all the data the customer needs, easy creation and maintenance of a robust data model with the customer's own concepts and metrics, with an AI-powered model for marketing measurement, and beautiful reporting on top.
   

  

 All this without the user having to write a single line of code or even be particularly technical. Our vision is that the people who need data for their decision-making should have the tools to do it themselves - and not be dependent on their technical colleagues.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Director Consulting Services - System development team Manufacturing, Stockholm
description:
As a Consulting Manager, you will play a crucial role by focusing on our most important assets: our clients, our business, and our employees. You will work with multiple existing clients within the Manufacturing sector while also being responsible for developing new business
   

  

 opportunities. You will be an essential part of CGI's continued growth journey, with significant opportunities to influence both your own and your employees' careers. Additionally, you will be part of the management team for the unit focusing on Manufacturing, where you will actively contribute to operational, tactical, and strategic development.
   

  

 We are looking for someone with strong experience in System Development and Service Delivery, who also has a strong passion for business development. We believe that you have an extensive network within IT and industry sectors and are experienced in engaging with clients to understand their challenges and opportunities in both digitalization and business development.
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 As a Director of Consulting Services, you will be responsible for the growth, financial performance, resource utilization, and competence development of your team. You will have profit and budget responsibility for your clients and team members.
   

  

 Your key challenge will be driving aggressive growth for the team, with a focus on the following areas:
   

  

* Business Development – Act as a strategic advisor to our clients, aiming to deepen partnerships and open new business opportunities.
* Leadership – Lead, develop, and motivate your employees to achieve both their personal goals and CGI’s objectives. Your team will consist of approximately 15–20 employees.
* Recruitment – Attract, retain, and recruit new talent to expand your team.
* Operational Excellence – Ensure the achievement of revenue, profitability, and growth targets in alignment with the team's roadmap and growth plan.
* Industry Expertise – Stay updated on developments within System Development and the Manufacturing sector to maintain a leading advisory role within CGI in these areas.
* Management Team Collaboration – Actively participate in the management team to develop the unit and maintain our commitment to being a world-class team.


**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
 We are looking for someone who enjoys developing both business and client relationships. You are driven by identifying new business opportunities that create value for clients. Your experience in Manufacturing and IT enables you to easily understand technology and discuss client needs, linking them to our services and strategic competency development for our employees.
   

  

 As a person, you are proactive and thrive in driving progress and change. You are a motivational leader who engages your employees, has a positive and communicative approach, and a strong determination to develop both the business and your team members. You probably have a technical background and proven experience in consulting or team leadership within systems development.
   

  

 We offer a challenging and stimulating role where you will drive the growth and development of your team and the unit, alongside an amazing group of colleagues and leaders.
   

  

**Want to Learn More?**
 We look forward to hearing from you! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled before the final application deadline.
   

  

 For any questions, please contact: henrik.sjostedt@cgi.com
   

  

****About CGI****
 CGI is leading the digitalization of Sweden and is a global leader in transforming innovation, information, and technology. With deep industry knowledge and an understanding of client challenges, we provide insights to drive sustainable results. We operate in 40 countries with 90,000 employees globally. In Sweden, we have approximately 4,000 employees across 30 locations, with headquarters in Stockholm.
   

  

 Learn more about CGI at: www.cgi.se
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Strategic Account Executive
description:
Join our dynamic, rocket-paced and newly Private Equity funded scale-up as a Strategic Account Executive and be a driving force in transforming and propelling us to new heights in Sweden and Norway! 🚀
   

  

 We are offering a truly unique opportunity for a highly motivated and experienced Strategic Account Executive to expand our presence in the Nordic market in Sweden and Norway. With the potential to tap into a vast array of retail Ideal Customer Profile (ICP) companies in Sweden and Norway, this role presents an unparalleled chance to build and expand from the ground up. As we embark on establishing ourselves as market leaders in delivering employee engagement apps for communication, training and operations for non-desk workers, we are seeking a candidate who can navigate the challenges of being an unknown brand in the market and transform it into a remarkable success story 🌟
   

  

 Already, we have amazing internationally known clients like Reitan, Specsavers, Mercedes-Benz, Gina Tricot, Tiger of Sweden, Telia, Peak Performance and many more, and our ambition is to create value for the Nordics's largest Enterprise clients as we turn Frontline Workers into Frontline Winners, with customized employee engagement apps 🙌
   

  

 Your key responsibilities
   

  

 As a Strategic Account Executive, your role will include, but will not be limited to:
   

  

* Drive the entire sales process, from pipeline generation to successfully closing deals with Enterprise brands
* Execute strategic account plans tailored to each prospective client, meticulously identifying key decision-makers and comprehending their specific needs and challenges
* Employ value-based selling techniques to showcase the unique benefits and ROI that our customizable app brings to clients, throughout the entire sales process
* Take charge of the MEDDPICC framework to meticulously qualify opportunities and skillfully manage the sales journey
* Foster and cultivate strong relationships with key stakeholders within client organizations, including C-level executives and department heads
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product, and customer success, to ensure seamless implementation and exceptional client satisfaction
* Surpass sales targets and KPIs and deliver accurate revenue forecasts


 Who are you?
   

  

* Minimum of 5+ years of experience with B2B Enterprise SaaS sales as an Account Executive
* Successful track record of closing complex deals and eager to penetrate the Nordic market
* It is an advantage if you have in-depth knowledge of the Swedish/Norwegian retail industry, including emerging trends, challenges, and a strong understanding of key stakeholders
* Extensive experience working within the SaaS sector and a profound comprehension of the value proposition and benefits of SaaS solutions for retail businesses
* Proficiency in value-based selling techniques to effectively communicate the unique value our customizable app brings to clients
* Proficiency in applying the MEDDPICC sales methodology to drive successful outcomes
* Outstanding communication, negotiation, and presentation skills, enabling you to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels of an organization
* Thrive in a fast-paced, target-driven environment and demonstrate exceptional ability to manage multiple priorities effectively
* Self-motivated and results-oriented, with a passion for building and expanding business opportunities
* Preferred qualifications include a bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field
* You are fluent or have professional proficiency in Swedish and/or Norwegian🇸🇪🇳🇴


 What do we offer?
   

  

* Grow together with a fast-paced scale-up company backed by the Private Equity fund Copilot 🙌
* A truly unique opportunity to tap into the immense potential of the Nordic market and transform it into a remarkable success story towards becoming market leaders
* Great level of responsibility from day one in a dynamic and international working environment
* Collaboration and sparring with a global sales team in Denmark, Sweden, and UK 🌍
* Competitive salary based on your experience and skills
* Many social events and passionate colleagues make every day awesome!
* Occasional business travels to HQ in Copenhagen to meet international colleagues 🌟


 When and where do you start?
   

  

* We are looking for a candidate to start asap, and ideally no later than August 1st, 2025!
* Regarding location, we are flexible as long as you are willing to travel to the Swedish/Norwegian clients wherever they are in the country - maybe you already live close to our next must-win client? 😎


 Apply for the position by sending your CV through the Apply button.
   

  

 We can't wait to hear from you! 🤩
   

  

 Who are we?
   

  

 Relesys isn't just another SaaS company; we are a dynamic force revolutionizing communication and performance management platforms. Established in 2014, we set out on a mission to bridge the gap between HQ and non-desk workers, fostering a thriving workforce.
   

  

 What value do we bring? People are the heartbeat of our client's business. When employees are thriving and successful, businesses flourish and retention rates increase. Relesys enables our clients to achieve this through an all-in-one app that streamlines communications, training, and daily operations into their own customized and ever-evolving app 📱
   

  

 With clients such as Salling Group, COOP, Carlsberg, and Vestas - to name just a few - Relesys serves clients in 15 different countries, supporting them in 33 languages with 395,000 licenses across 17,000 stores and users in 97 countries. We have a strong presence in the Nordics and EMEA, and we continue to increasingly attract clients from across the globe, as we are breaking into new, dynamic markets.
   

  

 At Relesys, we're shaping the future for frontline workers across various industries: Retail, Hospitality, Production/Manufacturing, and Transportation –
 *while having* 
**FUN** 
 , as our rule number one! Join us on this thrilling journey as we grow and venture into new horizons.
   

  

**Our Culture**
 Building a world-class organization and culture is our highest priority. We believe in the talent of our people and in long-term collaborations where we value an informal yet highly professional culture. We always go 'the extra mile' for our colleagues and clients, but rule number one - Have fun! This rule is always at the forefront of our minds when we come to work, creating an environment that is filled with passion, energy, and inspiration. We are eager to see what exciting contributions you, as our new colleague, will bring, as we believe that each and every individual has a tremendous influence on the whole 🌍

title: Technical Growth Analyst
description:
Svea Solar är ett av Europas ledande energitechbolag och revolutionerar hur människor använder och hanterar energi. Med över 50 000 kunder och mer än tio års erfarenhet levererar vi smarta energilösningar för både hem och företag och hjälper våra kunder att optimera sin energianvändning. Allt vi gör drivs av vår mission: att bygga en fossilfri framtid.
   

  

 Vi har precis lanserat vår nya site och nu växlar vi upp ytterligare – därför söker vi en
 **Technical Growth Analyst** 
 !
   

  

**Rollen**
 Som Technical Growth Analyst hos oss blir du en del av vårt ambitiösa och agila webbteam, där dina analyser underbygger vår tillväxtstrategi och skapar beslutsunderlag för hur vi driver vår webbplats.
   

  

 Din roll blir central i det praktiska arbetet med att samla in data och omvandla den till insikter för vårt marknads- och techteam samt våra andra marknader. Teamets betydelse växer i takt med att sajten får en allt mer central roll i vår affärsmodell, vilket skapar utvecklingsmöjligheter både för dig och din roll! Webbteamet har ett starkt affärsfokus och är en del av marknadsavdelningen,en spännande set-up som gör att vi kan arbeta nära affären med korta beslutsvägar och iterativa utvecklingscykler. I rollen rapporterar du till Oscar som är chef över webb-teamet.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden:**
* Övergripande tracking och uppföljning av företagets ledande KPI:er för både webbplats och app (primärt den svenska marknaden)
* SEO- och CRO-strategi
* Formulera hypoteser, A/B- och MVT-testa dem samt exekvera på resultaten
* Rapportering av site performance och relaterade projekt
* Tekniskt ansvar för tracking av alla våra domäner och marknader


**Är vi en match?**
 För att trivas på Svea Solar tror vi att dina värderingar stämmer väl överens med våra. Vi söker dig som har ett lösningsorienterat mindset, skarp analytisk förmåga med öga för detaljer och som trivs i en dynamisk och föränderlig miljö i en spännande bransch. Du har en god förståelse för både teknik och affär, och är van att paketera nuläge, potential och business case på ett sätt som engagerar andra.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har erfarenhet av:**
* Att jobba både med B2B och B2C (gärna även fysiska produkter)
* SaaS och LeadGen som affärsmodeller
* JavaScript och SQL/BigQuery
* Server-side GTM (sGTM) och Mixpanel
* Förståelse för vad som driver resultat i organiska och köpta kanaler
* Förmåga att prioritera aktiviteter utifrån de analyser som genomförs
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet i en liknande roll


 Det är meriterande om du har koll på Measurement Protocol, offline conversions, cookie-hantering, GDPR och hur man minimerar dataförluster.
   

  

**Svea Solar - Mer än solpaneler**
 Svea Solar är inte bara ledande inom solpanelsinstallationer och batterier, utan vi strävar efter att vara en långsiktig energipartner för våra kunder. Tillsammans med IKEA och andra samarbetspartners erbjuder vi en kurerad produktportfölj med smarta lösningar som gör det möjligt för våra kunder att producera, lagra och konsumera energi på ett kostnadseffektivt sätt. Vi arbetar ständigt för att utveckla nya lösningar som gör skillnad – både för våra kunder och för klimatet.
   

  

**Mångfald & inkludering**
 På Svea Solar främjar vi mångfald och inkludering eftersom olika perspektiv driver innovation. Här får du växa professionellt medan vi växer som bolag och bidra till framtidens energilösningar. Som en del av vårt team blir du en viktig del av "The Power Shift" – mot en grönare framtid, med fokus på teamwork, tillväxt och en härlig arbetsmiljö. 🌱🌞
   

  

**Om rekryteringsprocessen**
* Vi kommer att börja gå igenom ansökningar direkt, så vänta inte med att ansöka!
* På den här sidan hittar du mer information om vår rekryteringsprocess.
* För den slutgiltiga kandidaten gör vi en bakgrundskontroll av brottsregister.

title: Backend Engineer - Core Infrastructure
description:
We’re looking for mid-level Backend Engineers to join Spotify’s Core Infrastructure team. You will contribute to the development and optimisation of the foundational infrastructure that powers the Spotify platform. This is a highly impactful role and you will be developing the systems that enable Spotify’s engineering teams to deliver robust solutions quickly and efficiently to meet the demands of over a billion customers. You’ll design, build and develop scalable infrastructure services and tools, and collaborate in a cross-functional team.
   

  

 The Abs team in particular are responsible for building the central backend infrastructure and framework upon which hundreds/thousands of developers at Spotify build the Spotify experience. You will join a team of experienced backend engineers who share a common interest in providing a seamless backend development experience to Spotify engineers. Their goal is to eliminate any bottlenecks and smoothen out the Java backend development experience. Together we define and create the very foundation upon which Spotify’s many backend developers build Spotify’s user facing products. Above all, your work will impact the way the world experiences music.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Working with Java, libraries and getting onboarded to Spotify’s own Java framework, Apollo, to continue developing our backend framework.
* Collaborate closely with other engineers in cross-functional teams.
* Design, develop and operate business-critical backend systems with a focus on high availability, low latency and scalability.
* Have the ability to impact other squads' efficiency, across the entire company defining the future of our service framework
* Participating in an on-call rotation as part of the operational responsibility for services maintained by the team.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You are proficient in Java for backend development and you are able to apply your knowledge of the Java runtime environment to help us improve our backend service landscape.
* You are familiar with modern cloud platforms, preferably GCP, and tools like Docker for containerisation
* You are interested in contributing to core Java framework and are meticulously focussed on improving the Java backend development experience across Spotify.
* You are passionate about building high-quality systems and take pride in ensuring they perform at scale.
* You have excellent communication and collaboration skills, ensuring alignment across cross-functional teams.
* You care deeply about sound engineering practices like continuous delivery, clean code and automated testing.
* You are experienced in designing and building distributed and scalable systems and feel thrilled by the idea of seeing millions of users running your code.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London (UK) or Stockholm (Sweden).
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Strategic Product Manager/Head of Product Management - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)
description:
**Job Description**
**Strategic Product Manager/Head of Product Management - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)**
 We are looking for a
 **Strategic Product Manager** 
 who wants to be part of Tietoevry Banking. Tietoevry Banking is the leading financial services software and solution partner in the Nordics. We offer modular, pre-integrated banking as a service solutions and market-leading software for core, payments, credit, cards, financial fraud, and wealth. With our scale, expertise, and specialization, we empower financial institutions to enhance agility, efficiency, and accelerate digital transformation.
   

  

**When joining Tietoevry Banking you will work on:**
* Product Vision and Strategy: Develop and communicate a clear product vision and mid-term/long-term strategy that aligns with the company's overall Strategy, objectives and market trends. Define target customers, licensing and pricing models to address predictable long-term revenue flow. Define complementary services to support successful implementation and maintenance, ensure additional revenue flow.
* Market Analysis: Conduct in-depth market research to understand industry trends, competitive landscape, regulatory changes and customer needs, providing input and recommendations for strategic decisions for mid-term and long-term initiatives. Identify opportunities for product innovation and differentiation.
* Roadmap Development: Ability to translate market needs and business opportunities to a strategic roadmap and balance long/short-term needs. Create and maintain a high-level product roadmap that outlines key milestones, deliverables, and timelines, ensuring alignment with business priorities. Address product lifecycles, including planning sunsetting and migration strategies. Define innovation inception approaches. Plan portfolio modernization to fit market needs, ensure future growth and competitive costs.
* Relationship Building: Establish and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients, partners, and industry influencers to create new business opportunities. Participate, present and be influencer in conferences, industry workgroups. Build relationships with industry stakeholders globally. Demonstrate cultural awareness and the ability to adapt product strategies to various regional requirements.
* Stakeholder management: Collaborate closely with the sales team and engage with other departments, including engineering, marketing, project management and customer teams, to support with sales and ensure successful product development and launch. Cooperate cross-units in Cards and Transaction Banking and other units in Banking.
* Customer Insights: Prepare and present vision, pitches, and presentations to existing and potential clients and partners, effectively communicating the value proposition. Gather and analyze customer feedback and usage data to inform product decisions and enhance user experience.
* Performance Metrics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success and identify areas for improvement, ensure data-based decision making. Keep accountability on product/service profitability. Align models and use cross unit template and processes.
* Go-to-Market Strategy: Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to develop and execute effective go-to-market strategies for product launches and updates. Collaborate with Security, Compliance and Privacy teams to identify market or country potential risks and opportunities.
* Risk Management: Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful product delivery and adoption.
* Leadership and Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to product managers and team members, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.


**Who we are looking for:**
* A Bachelor's degree in business, Marketing, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
* Proven experience in product management, with a focus on strategic planning and execution.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.
* Experience in Cards and Payments, with a large network of connections with industry experts and decision-makers.
* Familiarity with European and Nordic customers.


**We also believe you have:**
* Strong strategic thinking skills to develop and implement effective product strategies.
* A market and customer focus that drives product innovation and meets customer needs.
* Excellent relationship-building abilities to establish connections with clients, partners, and industry stakeholders.
* Proficiency in public speaking to effectively present ideas and influence audiences.
* Strong negotiation and influencing skills to advocate for product initiatives and secure buy-in.
* A creative mindset that fosters innovation and the development of unique solutions.
* A results-oriented approach that emphasizes accountability and achievement of product goals.


 As a person, we believe you are a team player who takes action and demonstrates responsibility to organize your work and solve your tasks. With our agile end-to-end development process, you will continue to both learn from and coach your colleagues, so communication is important for us. Technology is developing fast, so learning new cutting-edge technologies is something you strive to do.
   

  

**What we offer:**
* We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, an open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance!
* We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.
* Competitive salary (up to 7,000 EUR gross per month in Latvia), based on experience and qualifications.
* Finally, we believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.


**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application! Interviews will be held continuously, so we encourage you to apply today! For more information or questions, please contact the Talent Acquisition team at recruitmentinbanking@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

 Location: Rīga - Verde, Roberta Hirša 1
   

  

*On specific positions, we might perform background checks.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion, and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiarize yourself with what we do.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.
   

  

 Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Finsktalande IT-supporttekniker
description:
Till ett uppdrag i Solna söker vi nu en social, driven IT-tekniker som kan både tala och skriva flytande finska och svenska. Du erbjuds ett varierande arbete som kräver engagemang och initiativtagande med hög ansvarskänsla. Tycker du om att arbeta med felsökning på både 1st och 2nd line nivå i bred miljö? Då är det här rätt tjänst för dig!
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

 Uppdraget är på heltid och kommer att pågå tills vidare.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Detta uppdrag som IT-supporttekniker kräver att du kan både tala och skriva flytande finska och svenska. Du erbjuds ett varierande arbete som kräver engagemang och initiativtagande med hög ansvarskänsla. Tycker du om att arbeta med felsökning på både 1st och 2nd line nivå i bred miljö? Då är det här IT-jobbet helt rätt för dig!
   

  

 Hos kunden kommer du att främst att supportera användarna via telefon och mail, men det kan även ske fysiskt på plats på kontoret. Du hjälper användarna med IT-relaterade frågor som rör användarnas datorer, utrustning, telefon, skrivare och program
   

  

 varor.
   

  

 Det vardagliga arbetet innefattar användning av ärendehanteringssystemet Servicedesk Plus, fjärrstyrning av användares datorer via den inbyggda funktionen Quick Assist i Windows, konto- och grupphantering via Active Directory - även via cloud (Azure och office 365 admin paneler) samt fjärrstyrning av servrar genom verktyget ASG-Remote.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet som 1st line IT-supporttekniker i Service Desk
* Goda kunskaper i Active Directory och Azure Active Directory
* Vana att felsöka genom fjärrstyring
* Erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem
* God telefonvana
* Goda vana att felsöka i en Windows och O365-miljö
* Talar flytande finska och svenska


**Meriterande**
* ITIL
* Relevant utbildning inom IT
